text: 12 oz. bottle, consumed on 5-21-17. ¬ì07/07/16,¬î presumably a bottled on date. Labeled as ¬ìAllagash Tripel Ale.¬î Pours an effervescent, medium to dark gold with a moderate amount of thin, short-lasting beige head. The shade and effervescence of the liquid is good, but the head is subpar in the initial pour. Final pour is hazier, darker, and duller, but the head is larger, creamier, more substantial, and longer lasting, and I bump the appearance to a 4. Pleasant, juicy, honeyed aroma. Scents of apple juice and Chardonnay. Buttery smell, not in a diacetyl way, but in an oaked white wine way. Quite sweet flavor with a dry finish. Honey and generic light-colored fruit juice. Melon and bitter orange peel. A touch of dust. Not sickly sweet but juicy-sweet in taste, but sweeter than I would prefer nonetheless. Hits the mark for a tripel, although it doesn¬ít seem to be particularly complex for the style, and it¬ís on the dull side. Medium to full body. A bit frothy and smooth but mostly forgettable (but not bad) palate effects. Easy to drink. Pleasant beer, well-made, doesn¬ít stray far from the Belgian model, but it does little for me.

12oz bottle. Pours a lightly cloudy yellow-gold with a small, quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is banana, clove, bread, yeast, subtle citrus, and herbs. Taste is bubblegum, honey, clove, banana, spice, light citrusy fruitiness, grass, yeast, and a little bit of cereal. Long yeasty finish with a good amount of alcohol. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Heavy, sticky, oily mouthfeel.

Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is a bit funky, but has some subtle apricot and nutmeg notes. Flavor is crisp bitter-sweet. Normally, this much residual sweetness would ruin a beer, but here it seems perfectly balanced. Some other aromatic notes come through in the finish: honey, ginger, parsley. Thick, velvety mouthfeel. Pretty darn good.
Honey ale with nice fruit an a little soul.refined alcohol and sweet angel body. Some malt and hop wafting ideal for a sophisticated drink day.

Caged and corked bottle pours slightly hazy golden-orange color with off-white head and lacing. Aroma: clove, yeasty banana bread, hay. Flavor: all of the above, with some white pepper, butterscotch, barnyard. Mouthfeel: Rich, creamy, savory. Super smooth and drinkable. One of my favorite beers from one of my favorite breweries.

I poured it from the bottle into a Stella glass. It pours golden with a small, white head and lacing. The aroma is banana, honey, and spice. The taste is banana, lemon, honey, and spice. It¬ís nicely balanced and hides the alcohol well. I like that it didn¬ít overdo it with the spice.

Murky, golden color. Fruits, spices and yeasts in aroma. Same notes in flavor. Sweet, malty beginning , dry finish. Extremely drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This one is loaded with character yet surprisingly smooth for a 9 percenter. Hovers somewhere, perhaps, between a heavy blonde and a skinny barelywine in overall gravity and texture.

Une bi√®re blonde, un peu voil√©e avec fort peu de carbonatation et d¬íeffervescence. L¬íar√¥me est peu pr√©sente, avec un peu de senteur de levures, sans plus. En bouche, ce qui me marque le plus est le sucre de la levures, la bi√®re est fort sucr√©e, avec une petite teinte de citron en arri√®re gout. Il y a √©galement un peu d¬íamertume, plus qu¬íune tripel √† la belge. L¬í√©quilibre est un peu moins au rendez-vous.

Extremely smooth and drinkable for a 9%ABV. The banana and honey overtones are spectacular and theres no bitterness or hoppy bite at all. Could easily put away 4-5 of these at a casual lunch.... and sail away for the rest of the afternoon!! üòè

I bought a 4-pack and had one each night over two weekends. The first one was good, but I thought a bit non-distinct -- aroma, flavors, etc. not jumping out at me. With each progressive tasting on separate nights, this beer got better and better. I could pick up the subtle aroma, sweetness (fruit, honey), and light herbals. The last of the four was very good -- I really enjoyed it. I would put this just shy of Ommegang¬ís Hennepin Saison and Gnomegang Blonde Ale. I would buy Allagash Tripel again if I were looking for this style.
(Tap) clear, bright yellow colour with a medium tall, white head; light aroma of tropical fruit, spice; thick palate; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass. Appearance is cloudy orange-yellow with fair sparkle, finger-width white foamy head with poor retention and trace lacing. Aroma is Belgian yeast, light caramel, peach/mango, candied and brown sugar. Taste is candied sugar with fruit/grapefruit, champagne. Palate is medium bodied with thick texture, lively carbonation, and dry mix of sweet fruits and tart yeast. Overall, a nice mix of disparate aromas/flavors.

October 21st, 2014 - This is batch 214 of the Allagash Tripel Reserve, a murky beer sealed with a thick cap of foam. And once that bubbly crust is penetrated, there¬ís a huge release of a dry yeast scent, swimming in pear juice and butter. The flavor is sweeter than the aroma, still dripping with ripe pear, but the sugars are oriented more towards a white grape juice flavor, alongside some bubble gum.
moderate malt aroma with faint spice notes. golden and hazy in color with nice long lasting head. taste is malty, light spice and stone fruit notes. smooth and clean finish.

On tap @ Allagash. Amazingly, I have not rated this. Might as well get the sample at the source! Clear golden beer with a white head. The nose is big on banana, bread, and caramel. Fair amount of sweet pear and apple as well. Slight spice, some yeast, and a touch of citrus peel. Very light alcohol as well. Fairly sweet beer, but not overly so. Pretty nice grass and slightly herbal aroma on the finish. Actually a little bit of bitterness.

Big bottle from the brewery during ecbt, consumed with commonmac and samadouche during cubs game. Gold with medium big white head. High alcohol nose, with sweet citrus elements. Carries good tripel flavor throughout. Body is ideal, spicy. Good clean finish. Nicely done.

Large bottle picked up at the brewery near Portland, ME. Consumed during the World Series with commonshawn and samadouche. Color is a golden with a tinge of orange. Nose is funky and yeasty with a nice spice level like you would expect from a tripel. Taste brings to mind other Belgian produced efforts in terms of its high quality. Spice plays a role with a little grassy element and a strong alcohol bite. Some sweetness almost like honey. Really nice nearly effervescent mouthfeel. Impressive beer overall. Another reason to visit the brewery when you have a chance.
Nice triple. A bit of pine and some barrel aged taste to it. Light on the yeast. Hazy medium yellow. Mouth is balanced and covers full. Tap

750 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. Thanks, I guess. You and that fucking book. The pour is a darker foggy golden color with a big pillowy white head that leaves some pretty good lace as it falls to a thick and dense cap. The aroma is decent. There is a lot of yeast and traditional tripel notes. A light honey and some decent malts are not too shabby. There is a light fruitiness that isn¬ít bad, but it¬ís just something that I know isn¬ít my jam. The flavor is full of much more clove and spice that the aroma hides. I dislike this pretty heavily. I wish there were more banana in it to hide the clove. The spice is complex and not awful, but the clove dominates. The mouth feel is a tough heavy and has a nice bubbly carbonation before drawing out on a spicy clove and interesting aftertaste. It¬ís not awful, but I¬ím not enjoying it.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is banana, clove, tropical fruit, honey, booze, sweet, floral. Appearance is golden, hazy, off white head. Taste is subtle, clove, banana, spices, tropical fruit, honey, starts slow but finishes heavy. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, spicy dry aftertaste. Overall, a decent enough tripel.

Light gold pour with haze. Clean tripel aroma profile, esters of banana, tropical fruits hint at yeast without overt yeast presence. Flavor is sweet, subtle spices, light citrus - very balanced. Medium body, very smooth, long clean, dry finish. Very yum.

12 oz. bottle from a 4 pack. Pours light gold with a 2 finger fluffy white head. Head recedes quickly leaving minor lace. Fruity, sweet aroma. Banana, apricot and honey. Sweet flavor with a fair amount of Belgian yeast funkiness. Full bodied. Very nice!

Pours a bright golden yellow color. Active carbonation throughout the session. Aromas of hops, fruit, and a little yeast. Has a light fruity citrus taste, with some yeasty notes, and a good hop flavor.

Medium wheat and plum smell, slightly cloudy...taste is sweet but hard to place the taste....also it is dry which is weird because of the sweetness....it just doesn¬ít stick to the palate....that¬ís unique....finishes with the slightest hint of hops, some diversity but not much

July 23, 2015. On tap at Allagash. 
Light hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malty, bready, some apricots, honey, almond, lemon and spices. Taste is medium sweet with honey, bread, almond and warming alcohol, light bitter with a grassy and spicy notes, smooth warming finish with slight spicy notes, some almond and apricots. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. 
Smoother and more warming than Curieux.

Originally rated on 8/15/08. My first beer from Allagash was a pleasant discovery. Out of batch#113 Their tripel Poured a creamy, hazy yellow, plentiful carbonation that formed a huge off white head. Aroma of fruits and spices, mostly apricot and a little plum. The taste also had the fore mentioned, but my only drawback was the alcohol it was rather noticeable but it wasnt bad. Mouthfeel was creamy and smooth even with the high alc. content. I thought it was a pretty good beer and i will purchase it again.

2016/03/10 - Pours a hazy orange-honey colour with a thin, soapy, white head that reduces to a film and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is honey, coriander, cloves, yeasty phenols (banana, bubblegum), herbal notes, peach and light citrus. Taste is honey, herbal notes, banana, doughy yeast, light citrus and spices. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with smooth carbonation and a long, herbal finish. Very nice triple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Allagash Tripel Ale. Not reserve. Large corked and caged bottle. Lightly chilled. Poured into a Chimay chalice. Large white pillow head thins after a few minutes. Some lacing. Beer is a haizy golden color. Aroma is mostly pear with some faint bannana notes. Taste is light to medium sweet with next to no bitterness. Some notes of fruits and clove. Texture is soft and smooth with light to average carbonation. Medium bodied beer. Over all a very good tripel. Much enjoyed.

Draught at the brewery during the tour.
APPEARANCE: dark blond beer.
NOSE: quite sweet, yeasty, some alcohol noticeable.
TASTE: quite good for a tripel, quite sweet and fruity.

Near perfection. Pillowy thick white head with complex but not overdone flavors and a subtle sweet honey finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2016 Pours slightly hazy golden. Spices (clove) & honey come through. Very smooth.
Bottled. Pours a murky orange. Has a big bold taste. Has a honey taste. A spicy herbal taste. With a hint of fruit. Very complex taste. Excellent triple.

Still fairly new to Belgium style ales. While I can certainly appreciate them I'm just not "getting" them jut having fun trying. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a slightly reddish amber, very clear, not terribly heady. Slightly spicy aroma of coriander, banana flavor, sweet candi sugar notes as well. Somewhat oily mouthfeel kind of puts me off. Good beer.

A part of a triple taste test and the winner! Got a bit of a candy and caramel flavor in the aroma. Taste is not too sweet and very drinkable. Very clear straw color with a nice poofy head. Light bodied.

Pours hazy blonde with a big white head. Nose is pleasant and fruity with just a touch of tempering hops and bread. Flavor is down the middle but rich with all of the sweet citrus and mild spice expected with a tripel. Nice and surprisingly dry finish. Good beer.

Really good Tripel. One of the best I¬íve had to be quite honest. Big sweet and spicy aroma. Lots of clove, citrus and phenolic notes. Very easy to drink. Absolutely delicious and the alcohol is so well hidden, you¬íd never know it¬ís 9%. Delicious beer, Cheers!

Pours hazy golden with thin white head. Nose is spicy. Aromas are fruits, bubble gum, spices (pepper, cloves), alcohol. Average carbonation, full body. Long alcoholic and spicy finish. Very nice American tripel!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle to a tulip glass. Pours an opaque golden with a thin white head. Smell is spices (mainly clove) with a good sweetness underneath. The taste is even more spice, with alcohol coming in at the end. The carbonation is light and the finish is long and warm. Wonderful beer.

After the Curieux, I figured the Trip would be almost identical; it isn¬ít the same, but it¬ís still a great beer. It¬ís a beautiful golden red. It¬ís a little more bitter than it is smooth, but it isn¬ít hard to drink. Allagash rules.
Not a bad tripel, a bit too boozie for my taste seems complex but to me the alcohol is perhaps too strong

Pour hay-coloured gold with a small white head. Head retention is good. AROMA: crisp wheat/malt, passion fruit, bubblegum, banana, spices, honey, hay, herbs, earthy, yeast esters, alcohol, cooked vegetables, herbal hops, peppercorn and slight rice. TASTE: crisp wheat/malt, passion fruit, bubblegum, banana, spices, honey, hay, herbs, earthy, biscuit, boozy, molasses, cooked vegetables, hop spice, peppercorn and slight raisin. AFTER TASTE: crisp wheat, spices, banana and honey with a crisp smooth spiced finish.
A Little lemony and simple triple that I tried in CT. As I had a bit more, I thought it had the subtle tint of a stronger lager.
Bottle. Aroma of spice and honey. Sweet and tasty spicy ale. Full body. A really good tripel.
Great local Maine brew. Fruity aroma and taste with great underlying flavors. Beautiful color and easy to drink!

Butelka. Barwa z≈Çota, mƒôtna. Piana kremowa, trwa≈Ça. Aromat intensywny herbaciany, chlebowy. Mo≈ºna wyczuƒá r√≥wnie≈º banany, cytryny. W smaku podobnie, dochodzƒÖ do tego smaki zio≈Çowe, suszone owoce. Goryczka ≈õrednia zio≈Çowa d≈Çuga, wysycenie wysokie. Piwo pe≈Çne, tre≈õciwe. Alkohol nie≈∫le ukryty. PodsumowujƒÖc, piwo ciekawe, niezbyt trafiajƒÖce w m√≥j gust.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2015 750 ml bottle in LA at yeastside meeting. Tripel yeast fruity ester aromas. High carbonation, moderate-strong bitterness, more than I personally like. Decent but not superb. Should try again.

Bottle, clear pale gold pour. light clean caramel malts, lemon, banana, honey, and clove. In classic tripel style, traditional hop notes, but all with a great balance between the malts, yeast and hop and drinks down too easily!

Pored into tulip glass a hazy golden with thin white head that dissipated to sides of glass quickly. Aromas were fruity, passion fruit, lemon and banana. Lemon on the sip turning to ripe banana and clove. Malts and yeast come through in the finish. Yeast lingers. Slightly thicker but just slightly oily, very smooth in the mouth. Love it.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2015 Pours a clear golden with a medium-high white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of peppery alcohol, fruity esters and pretty much the textbook tripel. Taste is of banana, light sweet cereals, light alcohol, fruits, pepper. Body is medium, carbonation moderate. Alcohol is being felt throughout but is never hot. This is pretty much as good as it gets!

Probada en The Jeffrey, NY. Cerveza estilo belga, con toques de banana y miel le dan un sabor dulce y picante. Aroma c√≠trico. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml bottle @ hotel room, Los Angeles.
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Sweet toffee and orange on the nose, yeast and spices. Spicy flavor, yeast, orange and some toffee notes. Good balance, nothing special here though.
3334

35,5 cl bottle @ hotel room, Los Angeles. Aroma has soapy citrus, some apricot and mild fruity tones. Flavour has soapy apricot, fruit sugar and some caramel. Rather sweet tripel, not worth the hype though. Too sweet for me, drinkability is not that great.

355ml bottle

Pours yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of yeast, ripe fruits, spices, honey and citrus. Taste is sweet, yeasty and spicy with loads of ripe fruits, honey, citrus and lemon. Finish is sweetish, slightly stuffy and yeasty with loads of ripe fruits and hints of spices. Sweetish but balanced.
Bottle (12oz): light golden with smallish head. Typical Belgian aroma with some fruitiness but more subtle. Taste is more fruity. Very refreshing perhaps my favorite triple.
Damn good trip. Golden to orange fairly clear nice carb with small white head. Excellent banana with lemon zest nose and flavor of clove and banana and crisp lightly tart finish.

12 ounce bottle. Hazy honey gold color with a small creamy white head. Aroma has notes of Belgian yeast and lemon peel. Flavor is much like the aroma, with yeasty notes and sweet fruit. Hints of banana and citrus. Smooth and complex with a nice warming alcohol finish. Very true to the Belgian Tripel style.
Poured into a snifter. Golden color with a white head. Aroma is Belgian yeast and some fruit. Flavor is similar, lightly malty with some fruity notes. Very nice, very drinkable tripel.

Draught @ Allagash Brewing Company, Portland, ME
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, dried fruits, passion fruit, yeast and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm yeasty and fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft
Bottle. Dry fruity aroma hits the nose with yeast. More to come in the flavor. Highly carbonated feel. Fluffy white head. Earthy hops. Lots of Belgian yeast. The ABV was not hidden well.

Aroma banana, dough, bread, spice, 
Appearance golden, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, average carbonation, 
Overall nice triple that hides the alcohol. I would suggest this beer to a friend
Good overall to style. Clean, dry and complex. Brilliantly clear and quite effervescent. Nice fruity notes! Another winner from Allagash in Maine!

Pours golden orange with a one finger off white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, ripe fruits, banana, cloves, some light funk, some sourdough bread, and some herbal notes. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma. Has a medium-full body with a creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, mostly sweet, medium-long finish. Overall, a excellent beer that is probably the best trippel brewed in America.

APPEARANCE - Pours dark straw color with enviable thick white head. NOSE - perfectly Belgian. Nice spicy notes. FLAVOR - Solid Belgian flavors. Slightly spicy hop flavor really stays in my mouth long after my last sip.

One of best American Triples. Nose of some Belgian type, yet bigger, some hops that are earthy. Continuing nose of all spice. Golden clear, bubbly head and lacing. Flavor of multiples of layers of grains and a yeasty ending with alcohol warmth.

Pours clear golden with white head that lingers to lace. Aroma of orchard fruit and herbal hops. Moderate carbonation with flavors of banana, honey, spice and slight citrus. Finishes crisp and dry with honey undertones and slight alcohol warmth.

on tap poured into a tulip glass..golden pour with a fluffy white head..aroma of bananas,bread,pears,grass..funky,dry,fruity,bready a huge tripel fan but this one is really good.Earlier Rating: 12/25/2013 Total Score: 3.9My first tripel, so I decided on this 4pk..12oz bottle poured into tumbler..nice straw, hazy yellow..aroma of bananas, pears, maybe even little coriander or sage..for a high abv offering was very surprised at the flavor..Will definitely be trying a number of other tripels in the near future.
Really great triple. Pours orange lively carbonation. Honey fruits and esters aroma. Slight warmth and mild cany flavor. Delicious finish.

Spencer trappiste glass. This brew is not as deeply complex as most Belgian tripels, but it definitely has the up front taste profile of a tripel, and hides its high ABV quite well. I really don¬ít care for banana in my beer, and this has a little aroma, but negligible flavor of the yellow fruit, so it¬ís OK. Smooth, flavorful and easy drinking, a commendable effort from Allagash.
Batch #210. Go√ªt d¬í√©pices, banane, pelure d¬íorange et alcool. Plut√¥t l√©g√®re en bouche pour une tripel et tr√®s buvable. Belle repr√©sentation des tripels belges traditionnelles.
Hazy golden pour with firm white, lasting foam. Aroma of apricot and other fruity esters. Tastes of honey and yeast. Smooth finish despite high carbonation, with lasting sweet, fruit flavors.

12oz bottle Pour is golden/honey colour. Head is rich and thick. Head lingers and emits aromas of banana and yeast. Tastes of tropical fruit and wheat combined to offer a sweet malty complexity that belays the 9% abv. Finsh is soft and sweet with persistent tropical notes.

Bottle, as "Allagash Tripel Ale." Fruity, large peach nose, with light fumes. Light honey color. Peaches, candi sugar, light wheat, tiny bittering. Medium body. Gentle and very pleasant. However, it doesn¬ít seem like a tripel, really.

Appearance is excellent with a huge foamy, frothy, thick, off-white head, that settles very slowly, some lace and a clear yellow color. Aroma is mainly yeast with some grain and a hint of fruit. Flavor¬ís like nose, slightly bittersweet, some tang, honey, rye bread. Body is a tad soft. Beer is very drinkable with a little alcohol warmth.

Tap at Blind Tiger, New York. Colour is cloudy light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, orange, spices, Belgian yeast, some sweetness and malts. Too sweet tripel but overall enjoyable.
I absolutely love this ale. It has a nice golden color with hints of various fruits and full bodied - It¬ís very complex in flavor and has a wonderful after taste :)

Pours a cloudy yellow-gold color with no lacing or head retention. Smells of banana and yeast. Tastes like Belgian yeast and bananas also. Not a bad beer at all and certainly does not taste like a triple.

On draft. Pale light straw colored, not too hazy, with thick white head leaving some lacing up top. Modest carbonation. Aroma is peppery, yeasty, very Belgian. Its a strong beer with an alcohol presence, bananas, peppers, bread, some candy sugar. A little simple compared to the greats, but tasty and not overdone.

From notes, on tap at the brewery. Pours clear amber with a briefly lasting white head that leaves some lacing. Weak aroma of tropical fruit. Weak flavor of banana with a stronger presentation of honey sweetness. Creamy texture, lively carbo, medium body and a long bitter finish.
Flight at tasting room. So much better with aging. Good and interesting but overall impression is too sweet. Yeasty and belgian-y. Slick mouthfeel. Complex. Smooth and long finish.

Free! Taster at the source. Pours orange gold with a clingy white head. Aroma is banana, pepper, clove. Flavor follows, nice balance. Starts with sweet banana, honey, wheat. Pepper and clove dry out the finish.

Light golden straw pour, silky tall head. Aroma of stone fruit and biscuits. Sharp carbonation with a berry like bubble gum taste. More bitter than expected, shorter finish than advertised. Bitterness was a bit harsh, sweetened as it warmed. I found this underwhelming.
Pours a hazy golden hue. Frothy white top. Nice balanced Belgian style flavor with citrus, banana, yeast, and some bitterness. A very nice American reproduction of a traditional Belgian style tripel.

12 onz bottle thx Heather and Frank A: spicy, herbacy, honey, subtle banana App: hazy pale white head good lacing t/p: full body with short and sweet finish. Moderate carbonation. O: great. Incredibly smooth. 9% really, can¬ít feel it at all. Balanced. 1000th rating.
Clear yellow with a strong Belgian funky smell, taste is vanilla and subtle spice, finish is long, crisp, and dry. A very good example of the style.

Bomber C&C. Batch 204. Clear gold with a small, clean white head. Aromas of pear, banana, honey, spice, yeast and some warmth on the end.. Flavor is pear, grapefruit, honey, spice, and yeast. Medium to full bodied, smooth with a warm end. A mostly sweet tripel.

12 oz bottle into a Chimay goblet.

A: Pours a semi-hazy yellow color. The head is a finger high, with a bone white shade and a creamier texture than what I¬ím used to from the style. Its staying power isn¬ít fantastic, unfortunately, but it does leave a good ring of lacing down the glass.

S: Oh wow, this is quite intriguing. After being immediately poured, it¬ís a rather peppery, bready smell - let it sit, though, and it develops great fruit notes. It¬ís heavily skewed towards bananas and lemons in particular. Candied sugar is quite prevalent. In fact, my only complaint is that it could be a little more subdued. Still, there¬ís no denying this has a wonderful aroma.

T: The flavors in general are pretty uniform - that is, it doesn¬ít start with flavor X and finish with flavor Y. Its notes of banana, wheat, candied sugar, lemon, and black pepper are consistent from start to finish. Some suggestions of herbal bitterness try to sneak their way into the back end, and this singular note is enough to convince me I¬ím drinking something very, very good.

M: It¬ís fairly sweet, and slightly less carbonated than its Belgian counterparts. The lingering sugar is felt, but there¬ís just enough dryness to help this go down easily. I think because the sweetness is rather chalky and coarse, it doesn¬ít stick to the palate like other high-gravity beers do.

O: This is a very solid tripel. Honestly, with many ¬íMurican made Belgian styles, there¬ís something - maybe subtle, maybe shameless, but it¬ís there - that tells me ¬íyep, this is as ¬íMurican as apple pie and obesity.¬í But with this, I¬íd swear it¬ís as Belgian as french fries if served to me blindly. It¬ís balanced, delicate, and easy to drink; that¬ís enough for me.

Clear yellow to orange pour with pale white head. Aroma is dripping with fruit. Canteloupe, pineapple, lemon and hard candies. Flavor is outrageously complex. Lemon, pineapple, pepper, grapefruit, more canteloupe, honey, something herbal like maybe a little mint? Palate is unmatched. Medium body with a lively carbonation that fills the mouth with meringue-like foam. Alcohol burn is there and keeps it interesting, but doesn¬ít dominate. This is one of those beers I was shocked to see I hadn¬ít reviewed yet, as I¬íve loved it for years. It¬ís a unique interpretation of the style, yet it fits right in and really stands as a benchmark American example. It¬ís so bright, lively and refeeshing, but deep, rich and complex. Probably
Allagash¬í best beer and one of the best Triples in existence.

Bottle:
Pours cloudy orange with a thin white head.
Yeast, passion fruit, mango aroma.
Semi-tropical fruits, yeast, orange malt....
Tastes like a Belgian boat drink.
Very fruity and tasty.

Hazy gold pour with a nice tan head. Fruity candy and banana esters on the nose. Flavor has some grainy malts to back it up. Little to no hop presence, but lots of yeastiness going on. Thick and slick mouthfeel with some warming alcohol action.

Light yellow minor cloudy 1 finger white head. Nose has a lot of herbal and pepper notes. Whoa, this is incredibly herbal. lots of sweetness.s has a good yeast character. Not that great and a bit too sweet for me.
Bottle. Lactic lemon, yeast, malt, and alcohol aroma. Hazy pale yellow with moderate head. Sweet lemon, yeast, malt, and moderately bitter herbal flavor. Mild alcohol finish. Very nice.

Pours light amber with a pillowy, white head that lingers. Copious lacing. Nose is musty apple cider and rich malt. Cherry and raisin notes. Taste is balanced. Sweet backbone with nice hoppy overtones. Full bodied and effervescent. Very nice brew!

Hazy golden with a thin white head. Aroma is banana and clove. Flavor is a little bready with light spice and banana. Pretty tasty.

Wife: 3.5

Bottled. Pours a lemon golden color with a small head. Aroma is tons of banana, candy sweetness, lemon, and of course that Allagash house yeast. Flavor is banana, clove, candy sweetness, Belgian spices. 
Awesome carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle share at Evernote. Aroma / Taste is fruity, red banana, earthy, floral, dewy meadow. Drank this while having a very lofty conversation about Adolf Loos and Bugs Bunny which certainly enhanced the flavor profile.

Aroma: intense caramel, vanilla. Appearance: clear yellow, massive, creamy, white head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: malty sweets continue, some alcohol. Overall: nice Tripel. Pint at Big Brew, Morristown.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2015 The initial pour appearance is a beautiful yellow honey gold, with a nice thick head. The aroma is beautiful with this one- lots of stuff going on here. Notes of yeast, hay, grass, subtle earthiness, and slight citrus altogether. Very lovely smell this beer has. It¬ís taste is almost as good though. It¬ís very sweet in the beginning, and then quickly moves towards a sharp alcohol warming. It¬ís not unpleasant, just abrupt. In the mouth it¬ís very smooth, almost cleansing with its high co2. Superb beer to pair with spicy and fried foods. Overall this is an excellent beer, one of the best tripels  I¬íve had. I certainly would drink it again!
"another solid brew from Allagash! Dry fruity aroma hits the nose with a hint of yeast. More to come in the flavor. Highly carbonated feel. Fluffy white head. Earthy hops. Nice brew."

Bottle to goblet
Barnyard funk, apple, lemon, bubble gum, wheat, and some booze. Translucent yellow with a long lasting bright creamy white head. Barnyard yeast, wheat, hay, and a touch of metal.

Reviewed from notes.
I poured this one into mostly chalices over the years but also had it in a couple tulips from time to time. There wasn¬ít any noticeable differences between the two.
The appearance had a nice looking hazy golden yellow color to it with a decent transparency about it. Some light carbonation is seen rising.
The smell had a nice arrangement of spiced apples, iced apples, earthy yeast, and some Belgian sugars.
The taste takes all of those flavors and combines them to make a wonderful complexity about this beer.
The palate was fairly light but made me want to think it came across closer to a medium on the body. The carbonation has a decent acceptable sharpness about it.
Overall, I say this was a great tripel well worthy of having again.

Appearance was cloudy light gold with lasting white fizzy creamy 1 finger head, lacing throughout. Aromas are fruity ester yeasts of banana, clove with slight pale, graham cracker, phoenals, no alcohol. Taste are sweet pale, crystal malts upfront, spicy clove and mild alcohol midway, then slight grapefruit bitter hop ending. Palate was creamy smooth CO2 with medium-full body, then the well-balanced smooth spicy fruity finish. A wonderful American triple, try it. Warms up well, sweeter.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass. It was bottled on 2/6/14 and came as part of a four-pack for $11.99 ($3 per bottle or $0.25 per ounce).

Appearance: Bright, almost glowing shade of lemon-skin yellow. Fairly clear with visible carbonation. Pours to an average sized, white, soapy head which laces and retains fairly well.

Smell: Banana, flowers, vanilla, and some spice.

Taste: There¬ís a definite difference between American Belgian-style tripels and authentic tripels from Belgium. It¬ís not that one¬ís better or worse, they¬íre both unique and enjoyable in their own way. Allagash Tripel is definitely one of the better American offerings on the style as it¬ís traditional at the core, though a bit different in the details.

The palate here is pretty familiar, though plenty tasty. Banana, clove, light citrus and tropical fruits are all quite prominent up front. The Belgian yeast plays a major component in the taste profile as it imparts a perfume or soapy quality. There¬ís a richer sweetness on the finish, akin to rum, as well as an intense peppery spice (the alcohol has a lot to do with this, too). Light bitterness through the middle helps the transition from the light sweetness to the spicy crescendo. Overall, an highly enjoyable, well-balanced palate.

Drinkability: Allagash Tripel is pretty potent at 9% ABV, and that intensity makes itself known via the robust palate, but also in the lingering warming sensation. The mouthfeel is crisp and bubbly, though it does go down quite smoothly. A lingering, peppery dryness in the aftertaste is to be expected, but it¬ís easily tolerable.

Appearance: medium gold.  Aroma: 	passion fruit, pine.  Taste: very tart, hint of honey, maybe clove?  Finish: long and slightly spicy/tart.  Notes:  "lost" rating from 2010-ish, from scant notes. Probably better than I remember, will need to try again.
Huge pillowy white head on top of a golden yellow. Boozy, herbal aroma more evident in the nose than in the taste. Very dry palate with a nice tropical fruit flavor and a light honey finish.
Bright yellow in color, fruity with a bit of spice. Triple that reminds me of a witbeir.

Bottle pour. Golden with good foamy head. Complex aroma with hints of orange, banana, coriander, and caramel. Medium body. Long lasting taste with flavors of everything in the aroma. Very good beer.

DATE TASTED: March 4, 2014... GLASSWARE: Affligem chalice... OCCASION: going out with a bang before a sober Lenten journey begins... APPEARANCE: hazy active light amber body; thin, uneven snow white head; random tracings... AROMA: intense orange peel, coriander, slight raisin, and melon--complex and inviting...PALATE: fizzy, medium-bodied; cutting, warm aftertaste that is also refreshing early...TASTE: sweet honey puckers the lips; soft herbal textures round the flavor into an extremely pleasant experience; startlingly unassuming for a tripel... OVERALL: elevational! By the bottle¬ís end, I was hoping for more...clean, floral hops sift between the stronger citric presence...a fitting Fat Tuesday celebratory beer, round, complex and alcoholic enough to be a party in itself...

Bubblegum, yeast, spices and chemicals in the nose, fruity, spicy and juicy in the mouth. Full body, very carbonated, long, fruity finish. Feels wheaty, fulfilling and very tasty.

A: Pours cloudy golden-orange hue with a durable off-white head.  The head lasted until the beer was gone, thoroughly coated the glass with lace when tilted, and left some patchy lacing on the glass.

Aroma & T: Complex and sweet aroma features tropical fruits, pear, and light spices. The taste has these characteristics too, but add some tartness, traces of wild and Belgian yeast, and some alcohol esters. 

M: Medium body; medium-high but soft carbonation.

O: Excellent and well-balanced mix of flavors and aromas: an impressive Tripel even by Belgian standards.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks kerenmk. Batch #189. Pours an hazy yellow with a foamy head, aroma of bubblegum, vanilla, apple, guava, flavor is sweet with bubblegum, coriander and carbonation, medium bodied

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks kerenmk. Batch #189. Hazy deep golden with a big white head. Aroma has some fruity esters, yeast, light spiciness and a bit of wheat. Flavor starts slightly sweetish and fruity, continues spicy yeasty and drier a bit of bitterness and a bit of alcohol. Medium-bodied.

Bottle, batch 168- pours hazy golden. Nose of banana, honey, wheat, clove and tropical fruits. On the tongue, oak, bread, honey malt sweetness, Belgian yeast. Smooth for sure 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This was an impressive Tripel ¬ñ very complex in flavor and aroma and enough alcohol to make it interesting.

Bottle from Corvallis Brew Supply via Phil. Batch #149. Pours a cloudy golden color, little bit of white head. Aroma is funky and citrusy. Medium body, finish very estery and sweet, lots of banana. Turns dry, hints of brett. Superb.

Bottle pours a nice frothy head that laces the glass. Poured into a tulip glass for Belgian brews, hints of banana and spice, but not overwhelming, allows the gentle hops, light malt and dry profile to show through. Outstanding effort, a slight alcohol booziness. Drinking in the chill of March today, expect this would still be enjoyable on a warm July evening.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Pours a rich, hazy gold color with a two finger frothy white head. Smell is fruity and slightly malty. Strong yeast smell as well. Taste has lots of fruit and some malt to it. Belgian yeast and some alcohol as well. Lively carbonation with a smooth aftertaste. Very good, especially after aging for a few months. Batch 117, 214.

Blonde voil√©e, mince mousse qui tient au parois. Arome levure, alcool, citron, herbe, mangue. Gout √©pic√©, attaque le palais et la langue. Gout repr√©sentatif de l¬íarome. finale longue et chaleureuse. Bon, mais pas impression√©.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle thanks to lukaduke. Pours a hazy copper to gold with a whispy, cloudy white head of foam. Aroma has lots of banana and clove esters. Bready in the finish. Zesty. Bubbly mouthfeel. Very good tripel.
Bottle->trappist.  Pours a hazy gold with effervescent white head.  Aroma: yeast, biscuit, clove, tart fruit.  Taste: yeast, honey, banana, tart fruit.  Moderate carbonation, pretty smooth.  Good.

2009 bottle, thanks to... damn, these tasting sessions. cloudy pale yellow grey-ish with a nice frothy white head, good retention and lacing. biscuity and bready malts, light toastiness, very fruity - white grapes, coriander, very spicy hops, vinous characteristics - even some woodiness. some honey sweetness - never cloying. lively carbonation, medium body - oily, very nice grassy-herbal finish. very nice aged brew.

Pours lighter gold with a medium white head which sticks around, leaves great lacing.  Aroma is Belgian yeast, citrus, candied sugar and pear.  Taste is sweet with moderating bitters, but overall pretty sweet.  Medium bodied with a sticky finish.  Good carbonation leads to a lively mouth feel.

12oz bottle into Trappist glass.  Hazy golden yellow color with half-finger of white head.  Aroma notes of fruit (banana, pear, lemon), spices (clove dominates), honey, bread and yeast.  Taste hits with the fruity/spicey Belgian yeast, tart, balanced with sweet honey malt and light hop notes.  Medium body, lively carbonation and dry finish.  Very good Tripel.

This beer is a cloudy yellow color. It has a yeasty aroma. It tastes like banana bread. It is clean on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle, batch 171.

Poured into a Delirium Tremens glass. Pale amber color with two fingers of head that refuses to retreat. It sits so perfectly in the glass.
All sorts of fruit on the nose: banana, lemon, pear and lemongrass.
It tastes also exactly like it smells: banana, lemon and bread. Then at the end is a yeasty/bitter taste, which was out of place. On the pleasant side, there is a nice alcohol after taste. 
Smooth and bubbly, then crisper at the end.
Superb looking and good smelling. The taste was right on until the end with the yeast/bitter taste that just did not belong. Maybe it was this batch or bottle.

Batch #189. Gorgeous head, nice cloudy golden color. Nose is full of banana and yeast. The taste is... wow. In fact, that¬ís exactly what I said out loud after my first sip. Flavors are also banana and yeast with a little spiciness at the finish. Hides its high ABV expertly. A world-class beer.
Cloudy golden.  Lots of belgian spice and clove.  Some banana.  Close to ebil weis.  Not bad

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 Pours nice and golden with a frothy head. Aroma is of passion fruit, little bit of citrus fruit, light honey, banana and a small amount of clove. Good carbonation. Tastes of classic Belgian brewing spices. Honey notes with caramel,apple, pear, apricot, banana. Great Tripel. Among my favorite beers.

Re-Rate on 3/19/14 by Adam....Pours a nice golden haze with an average white head.  Aroma is passionfruit and honey foremost followed by a hint of banana and strong clove with maybe some citrus in there...can¬ít tell if it is citrus or the uncommon combo of honey and passionfruit.  Taste is so amazingly balanced.  The passionfruit and honey dance off the clove to make the clove less offensively strong then I typically feel.  Banana and some other fruits finish it off with the lightest sweetness. Is carbonated just right for the palate, full and not watery but still smooth. Only adjustment on ratings on re-rate are taste from 8 to 9, everything else identical.

Pours a mildly hazy golden colour with a really nice soapy white head leaving a bit of lace up the glass. Aromas of banana, spicy, fruity, floral. Flavours of  spice/fruit/alcohol blend, some banana notes, alcohol is a bit sweet, some lemon, pepper, yeast on the finish.

Pours a hazy golden color with a frothy white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of fruity esthers, banana, spices, mild alcohol & some herbal earthiness. Taste of honey malts, spices, banana, candy sugar & a light smooth alcohol taste. High carbonation & a nice creamy mouth feel from a smooth complex malt profile.

Hazy gold pour with a medium, fine-bubbled white head which fades to short and leaves moderate lace. Pine and citrus hop nose, with some dough. Medium body and big, though fine-bubbled, carbonation. Mouth feel is accordingly creamy. Belgian yeast, light caramel malt, tobacco, a touch of farmhouse, pine and citrus hops and more yeast, bread and cheese in the dregs with the sediment. Finish is medium, dry and umami.

Delicious little beer. Pours gold with a medium foamy head, slightly hazy. Herbal aroma, some apple esters, a little alcohol in the aroma as well. Tastes slightly grainy, also a little clove. Slightly stinging carbonic bite, some alcohol warmth.

Mild herby scent. Clear, pale gold in color with a slight reddish tinge.  Medium sweetness and not very bitter.  Medium bodied and crisp - very fizzy. Overall, light, pleasant, and refreshing. Recommended for a summer day.

12 oz. bottle as "Allagash Tripel Ale." Pours a slightly hazy golden with a fluffy eggshell head that settles down fairly quickly leaving some soapy rings of lacing. Nose involves honey, herbs, flowers, spicy hearty yeast, and candied citrus. Really nice nose. Taste is fairly sweet, with a nice balancing bitterness. Palate is toward medium bodied, creamy, slick, crisp, bright, juicy yet dry on the end. Fantastic brew, multi-layered, clean, delicious, wonderful.

12oz bottle. Hazy yellow/orange with a white head. Aroma is earthy, citrus, sugar and spicy pepper. Flavor of zesty Belgian yeast, sugary malt and honey with a light tartness and no alcohol taste. Medium body with active carbonation. Really nice beer, well balanced, not overly sweet and lots of yeast character.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2013 It has a light golden color. Smells very pleasant . It is very easy to drink with no alcohol taste. Overall when of the best tripels Ive tasted.

Hazy golden pour with nice frothy white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of citrus and banana. Flavor is strong and sweet with honey, banana and alcohol. Aggressive metallic finish.  I may have drank too cold, and flavors may meld better if warmer or allowed to settle more.  Good but not great tripel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy golden with a limited white head.  Citrus notes with a touch of alcohol and yeast finish.  Medium body average lacing and short finish.

Bottle: golden pour with large frothy white head. Aroma is spicy belgian yeast, honey, and caramel. Flavor is sweet with, caramel, honey, over-ripe banana and a little bisquit, then spicy/acidic with dusty yeast, alcohol, and high carbonation. Decent flavor, maybe should have laid this one down awhile so flavors would gel more. Not my favorite tripel.
Bottle. Pours yellowish with fruit aromas. Quite a bit of fruit and malt flavors. Much better than the double.
Gold pour, full white head. Grain and citrus in the nose.  Sweet, more than not on the tongue. Citrus and soft fruit, chased by alcohol. Hops and alcohol finish dry compared to the rest.

Golden yellow color, bright white head. Good retention to this and body to head. Nice looking beer. 
 
Cereal, orange, honey, passion fruit, orange, and slight notes of banana. Nice deep and complex nose. 

Banana, caramel, bread, orange and honey taste. More like a dessert wine in complexity and depth of the flavors. 

Low carbonation but prickly at times. Orange peel and honey finish. 

Seriously good beer and on par with Belgium

22 nov 2012, bottle. Light yellow, clear, steady bubbles. Nose is coriander, oranges, sweet cereal malt, and rich yeastiness. Med body and moderately fizzy. Light coriander, sharp yeast, rich malt, faint orange peel. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
nice sweet fruit aroma,yellow, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, creamy, nice light alcoholic finish.

Hazy gold with little head. Aroma of tropical fruit and yeast. Taste is the same. Good lively carb. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 750ml. [Batch 176]
Pours clear blond with low super duper resilient white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of fruits, yeast, malt, sweetness, alcohol. Taste is of fruits, candi-like sugar, malt, yeast. Palate: crispy feeling. Overall: Pretty good. Crisp. Well balanced.

Nice carbonation, a beautiful head. The scent is of citrus fruit with a touch of yeast and malts. The taste is even better. There was more tartness than bitterness. The drink has a dry mead like quality with a slight hop flavor. Overall the Triple Reserve is worth having and it is very kind on the palate.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle shared with a friend. Cloudy greenish gold pour with a short lived white head and no lacing.  Spicy citrus nose.  Lemon and orange peel notes. Slightly bitter lingering finish.

355 ml bottle. Rated on 15.10.2012.
Pours a hazy golden colour with a white large head with good retention. Aroma of grainy malts, honey, banana and dried fruits. Flavour is rather sweet with honey, yeast, floral hops, apricot and some grains as on the aroma. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Long fruity finish where alcohol gives some warmth. Very tasty.

Hazy golden yellow body.  Large white head, solid lacing.  Nose is lightly sweet, with clove, banana, bready malts, and light peppery yeast.  Flavor is similar but with a more mellow fruity citrus,  Light spice profile.  Pleasant.  Medium bodied, lightly boozey, effervescent carbonation.  Semi dry finish.

Bottle at home with my dad. Pour is bright, hazy, golden with a bright white head and good lacing.  Clove, biscuit, light banana, herbs, straw in the aroma. Taste is spice, clove, fruity esters, citrus, tang, and white pepper with a spicy finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Well-balanced, spicy, and fruity with well-hidden alcohol. Nice!

2009 vintage.  Gold/amber pour.  Aroma of plum, candied fruit, alcohol (brandy?) and loads of honey.  Candied fruit up front, farmer¬ís honey (the good, organic stuff).  Plum, slight peach, brandy, slight heat from the booze even after 3 years.  if you¬íve been aging this, this winter may be a good time to give a few sips.
2009 bottle. Clear Golden pour with white lacing. Lots of clover honey on the nose. Some plum, honey and brandy flavours. Finish is sweet with some alcohol heat

pours golden unclear yellow, with a white head.  The aroma is fruity, cloves and sweet. the flavor is banana front front to finish and after taste.  along with sutle honey flavors. towards the rear.  The palate is thick up front but smooth going down, and for being 9% extremely balanced.  I would recommend this, quite tasty brew
Dark yellow coloured and clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Sweet, yeasty aroma. Some alcohol. Sweet flavor, more yeasty notes. Some marcipan, almond. Creamy.

Pours a light orange golden color with a two finger sticky foam head. On the nose is zesty spicy belgian yeast, tropical fruit, honeyed malts. On the palate its a beautiful balance between sweet honeyed candy, spicy earthy yeast, bit of fruit on the mid palate and a clean focused finish. Hard to believe its 9% because it masterfully hidden.  Great example of a tripel that I haven;t had in years... sometimes I forget how spoiled we Mainer¬ís can be !

12oz bottle, from my parents. Hazy yellow color. Good big foamy white head. Decent lace. Really nice yeastiness - estery, light white pepper, little banana, light orange peel, herbs. Seeing the honey. Nice sweet taste, little tart kick in the finish, pretty zesty overall, good spicy taste. A nice light bite. Soft, smooth moderate carbonation, good texture. Mostly dry texture. Very enjoyable and drinkable tripel
Bottle. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Not that powerfull fruity notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Long average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.
Bottle, 9%. Clear deep golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, honey and fruit. Flavour is malt, medium sweet, yeast, honey, fruit, spices, hop, little dusty and a little bitter.
Bottle @ HenrikSoegaard tasting. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 280912

Tap - average size foamy head, hazy medium straw color, Belgian
yeast/banana/clove, aroma & flavor, balnaced with some light sweet malt

Pours a pale gold with nice velvety head, the aroma is yeat at the forefront, carbonation is good and again smooth not crisp, taste of  citrus, some spice and a little fruit. Finish is very nice with the warmth from alcohol coming in at the end

Bomber. Batch 115, cellared several years.
Pours a lovely golden. Cloudy, with a quickly dissipating head.
Nose is sweet, spicy, with notes of fruit and honey. Full bodied, with a gentle carbonation. Round and sweet, with tastes of fruit, gentle spice, candy sugar, balanced with the complex esters of the yeast. Lovely.

Pale yellow, cloudy, tall white head. 
Nose suggests iron, 
Mild bitterness, off-dry, medium body, very complex and delicate fruity flavors, including orange, honey, yeast, very complex if not lingering post-taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Delicious. On tap at rebar brooklyn. Very aromatic drinkable triple. Alittle sweet and alcohol warming - medium body and lingering 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Pours a hazy straw color with a medium head.  Great aroma of yeast and tropical fruit.  The flavor has similar elements, with honey and a touch of citrus as well.  An excellent Belgian-style Tripel; hard to find much not to like with this one.
Bottle. Pours a hazy light yellow color with a very small head. Nose has metallic and sweet notes to it, which I¬ím not a fan of. Sweet tones to the flavor with a bit of a floral finish.

Golden yellow. Subtle florals, honey and cinnamon spice nuances, give way to candied lemon, light orange peel and a good amount of clove and banana. Soft mouthfeel, finishing with clove, candied citrus and Belgium yeast.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Aroma is belgian yeast quite appetizing. Appeaarnce is golden hay with a touch of orange peel at the top. Taste is great yeast and then honey and grains(cant place which grains). Palate is smooth only slightly dry and sweet. Gorgeous pour,light and tasty alcohol is all but non existent, shocking!

Bottle poured a magnificent cloudy golden with a huge fluffy white head and notable lacing.  Aroma is a pleasant mix of banana, grass, honey, and apricot.  Taste begins with some sweetness from citrus and vanilla followed by floral and Belgian yeast notes before a crisp finish.  Enjoyable mouthfeel with flavors lingering on the palate.  Very tasty, drinkable tripel.

On tap at Of Love & Regret.  Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head.  Soft musk, toast on the nose.  Medium bodied, smooth and musky.  Warm and gentle, subtle toast, light bitterness.  Warm musk on the finish.

Had at tasting at the brewery for the tour.  Pours a light straw gold with a nice frothy medium white top.  Aroma is lots of grain, belgian yeastiness and honey.  Taste is nicely carbonated, light grains and sweet honey with the dryness of the belgian yeast.  Loved it.
UPDATED: JUL 27, 2012 Alcohol burn is more noticeable in this American variety than in its Belgian cousins, but the flavor is spot on. Agood example of the tripel style

12 ox bottle pours a hazy straw yellow with a white head and good lacing.  Aroma is fairly complex, with raisins, bread, bananas, peach, and something earthy.  Medium to full body, with a moderate carbonation.  Tastes slightly sweet with a long finish.  I¬íll definitely revisit this one again.
Bottle @ Uva bar, downtown Disney. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, yeast, grass, malt and hops. Sweet finish.
Complex aroma of subdued fruit, earth floor and honeycomb. Hazy goldenrod with a fluffy, white head of small bubbles. Well rounded flavors of earth and sugar, with husky grain.

Bottle. Thin white head on a lightly hazy golden straw yellow. Ripe peach, apricot, vanilla, sweet bite grapes in the aroma. Slightly sweet and wish it it was a bit more clean and snappy, but more white grapes, vanilla and slight touches of clove and all-spice. Medium to light body that¬ís missing snappier carbonation.
Hazy gold pour with no head.  Some lacing.  Aroma of bananas.  A very refreshing taste.  Some apple and stone fruit.  Yeasty funk.  Easy to to drink.

Bi√®re blonde voil√©e, coiff√©e d¬íune mousse dans la moyenne laissant une dentelle typique aux parois du verre. Des ar√¥mes fruit√©s, √©pic√©s et de levure en √©manent, sans √™tre trop prononc√©s. Good pair with spicy Italian food. The beer smells fruity and floral. The beer is a slightly hazy golden with a big white head. The beer tastes sweet with notes of flowers, clove, and some citrus. Creamy and full in the mouth, the beer complemented a spicy marscapone sauce very well.
Creamy aftertaste I don¬ít find attractive and seems consistent with Allagash beers I¬íve tried, but on the whole, a solid, smooth tripel.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2012 Poured from bottle. Golden color, creamy head. Cloudy. Floral and sweet. I expected this one from Allagash to end up at the top of my triple list, but it was too mellow and sweet for me.

From the bottle poured a hazy, golden brew with a rich, thick head that wouldn¬ít go down. Interesting aromas of sweet malt, hops, and hints of citrusy tartness. Medium bodied with flavors of malt, lemon peel tartness and a easy hop finish.

Bottle. Yellow amber with voluminous cream head and light lacing. Clean crisp notes in the aroma with a slight sour apple sensibility plus- hmmm... raisin bread. Sweet tart flavor. Slight tang fading to a dry funky  note. Me likey.
Allagash never disappoints, and this Tripel Reserve is no different. A rich blonde that is cloudy as any good hefe should be. This one will be a staple in the beer fridge.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2012 750 ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head.  Aromas of Belgian yeast, herbal fruit.  Medium bodied, a great tripel

2011 pours hazy yellow with pillowy white head.  Smell is musty grainy Belgian funk. The taste is clove, bread, banana, cherry, farmhouse funk and all things that make a Belgian tripel traditional. The carbonation is lower, due to sitting. The finish is slick and effervescent, so good.

An approachable high gravity beer. I did expect more bite, but the swift finish was impressive for a 9%. Pour was exceptional only in the aroma. Head and body were a might underwhelming. Great dinner or lunch accompaniment.
This is a good beer. Good drinkability but ive had better tasting tripels in the past; semi disappointed

Pours cloudy blond with a bit of head. Smells initially like a German hefe then gives way as it warms up to a bazooka bubble gum aroma. Taste is soft and pleasant on carbonation. There¬ís plenty of good florals involved in this operation and even a little hay, citrus and banana. Bottle from City market Onion co-op in Burlington.

In the glass it¬ís cloudy with an apple juice color, and it pours with a gigantic head that hangs around forever like a mound of slowly melting ice-cream and laces down the sides of the glass until the last sip.  The aroma is a bit subdued, but alcohol and fruit is present along with grassy hops.  The label says that I¬íd detect passion fruit in the flavor, but I don¬ít know from passion fruit.  I did pick up on apples and apricots and dry, clean malts.  Kinda dry, kinda crisp.  I liked it.

Pours a cloudy vibrant yellow color with aroma of passion fruit and honey.  Taste is slightly sweet but with a fruity mashed banana taste.  Overall a decnt tasting beer that hides the 9% alcohol content well.  A decent beer for the style.

Pours hazy golden with nice white head. Spicy taste and aroma (pepper). Slight brett (?). Full bodied beer. Some warming alcohol.
Robe dor√©e sombre. Beau collet blanc. Go√ªt et ar√¥me √©pic√©s (poivre). Un peu de brett (?). Ronde en bouche. Pr√©sence d¬íalcool ressentie.

Bottle 750 ml. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is peppery (green pepper) with notes of green apple, mango and slight brettanomyce. Taste is peppery and malty with a bunch of other spices and a slight bitter end. Body is medium to full with a pleasant warming alcohol. Very good, complex and well balanced tripel.

From notes. Pours a cloudy golden colour with slight white head. Aroma is yeasty with noticeable banana and clove. Flavor follows the aroma; yeasty and citrusy hops orange peel and lemon zest.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

12oz bottle poured into a trappist glass with a golden yellow and a medium white slowly dissipating head. Aroma of sweet spicy fruity notes, some ripe apple, Belgian yeast, light biscuit malt and sweet alcohol esters fill the senses. Taste is Belgian yeast, light biscuit malt, light banana, spicy fruity notes, with some spicy hops bitterness. palate is a medium body, crisp with very nice carbonation. Finishes with some sweet spicy fruity notes, Belgian yeast, with some nice spicy hops for balance, ending is a slightly dry finish with a bit of lingering nutty notes. Overall a very good,well balanced, flavorful and tasty brew, an all around solid tripel.

As i pour this beer i notice its cloudy/hazy golden yellow color.  I smell this brew and smell the yeast not so much the passion fruit or the herbal notes or honey as the label sugests.  However the taste is not only smooth and sweet, i guess one can say a fruity taste with a medium body.  A taste of alcohol on the mid/back of your tounge leaving an aftertaste of honey.  Over all not a bad brew worth a buy and rebuy.

Draft.Yellow cloudy gold with nice lace. Aromas of light wheat spice yeast pleasant bread grain citrus. Med light body showcasing spice clove phenols light pleasant, light malt. Citrus. Med-light carbonation. Flavours linger through a complex finish.

Pours honey golden with a tower frothy head. Aroma suggests tropical fruits and honey, with a hint of grainns and yeast. The hop taste is a bit overstated for a tripel. Beneath that, a balance mix of light pilsner malts, soft tropical fruity esters, and a touch of light medicinal esters, like from clover honey fermentation, balance everything out nicely. Palate feel is pretty dry and heavily carbonated with a hoppy finish accompanied by some malty sweetness. A nice American take on a classic style.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy yellow-gold with a frothy white head. Aroma is of yeast, floral/herbal notes, and spice. Taste is initially yeasty with some veiled coriander, clove, and pepper followed by a crescendo of spice, which mellows out after a climax. The remainder of the beer brings out veiled notes of honey and toffee toward the finish, which is subtle and lasting. Very smooth and balanced. A great tripel.

On tap at The Great Lost Bear in Portland, ME. Pours a clear, golden colored body with a finger-width, frothy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is slightly yeasty spiced up front with some tropical fruits, apple, and citrus making up a moderate fruitiness. A light caramel and toffee sweetness with some Belgian yeast banana esters. Flavor is similar. Belgian yeast with some nice esters giving off a light banana, clove, and coriander spice. A nice, slightly bready caramel and toffee maltiness with some tropical fruits, citrus, and apples in the middle before the yeast gets peppery towards the end and this finishes mostly dry with a light bitterness. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid tripel. Sweet and spicy with some pleasant yeast esters and a solid malt and fruit balance. Good beer.

Draft at Moriartys. Hazy golden pour with some white foam. Thick loose honey mouthfeel. Banana. Sugar cane rum. Pineapple. Clove. Orange rind. Like a hoppy sweet tripel. Light citric flavors with a fair amount of sweetness but enough bitterness for balance.

Pours an attractive, slightly hazy golden yellow with a nice white head. Strong, fruity aroma has an undertone of butterscotch and a hint of yeast. Scrumptious flavor fills the palate with apple, banana and butterscotch plus a hint of bitter hops that nicely balances the sweetness. Smooth, lively texture has good body and plenty of fizz to leave behind a slightly sweet, slightly hoppy bitter tingle. Recommended.Earlier Rating: 1/17/2009 Total Score: 4Pours a beautiful hazy honey-golden with some white head. Aroms is crisp, fruity and malty, with hints of honey and lemon. Malty flavor is a little tart with a fruity undertone and a touch of caramel. Texture is very smooth, and finish is just a little sweet. Very satisfying.
Les m√™mes caract√©ristique que la dubbel mais avec l¬íalcool qui perce un peu plus. Finale d¬íamertume poivr√©e, presque v√©g√©tale.

Hazy golden body, white head. Aroma is complex malty with caramel and fruity yeast. Flavour has noble hops, raisins, spices and fruits. nice yeasty aftertaste. Very smooth and balanced. Slight bitterness for a tripel, but holds it well.

[bottle at DwEEBs meeting]
Very fruity, tropical aroma that is complex and just a touch sugary. Almost clear gold under a lasting, white foam. Sweet, tropical fruit flavour with nice lychee fruit and pineapple. Moderate bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation, slightly warming.

Draft in a tulip. Hazy golden color, good white head, citrus and malt stand out. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Sweetgrass Diary. Slightly hazy golden pour with a fluffy white head. Bouquet of honey, sweet malts and Belgian yeasty spices. Sweet malt entry with bubble gum, honey, yeast and spices. Finishes slightly sweet. Very tasty beer.

Bottle supplied by, and shared with, ck1. Thanks bro! (my first tripel! and being compared with his homebrewed tripel - which was extremely similar, slightly more malty but excellent) Pours pale golden with a very white head. Aroma has bananas, cloves, a very belgian aroma. Taste brings very crisp, layered sweet fruit with cloves and spices. Some alcohol presence. Very interesting; a wit with multiple layers on top. Nice, I¬íll try others.
Color of peach nectar, creamy head. Fresh floral/fruity nose. Spiced flowers. Nutmeg, cardamom. Light fruits. Apples and oranges. Hint of caramel malts.
Nice orange tint, large white head when poured.  The flavor is sweet and lasting....definitely a good beer to try.

Clear gold with a pillow of off-white head. Light effervescence and lacing. Aroma of lemon and tropical fruits, wheat, biscuit and flowers. The taste is crisp and well balanced; malt and honey sweetness with a mild bitterness, and the alcohol is well masked. Medium bodied and slightly fizzy. Good, but kind of plain for what I¬íd imagined.

Poured from the bottle into my trappist glass. Aroma is banana and Clove. Flavor is yeasty bready, and I do notice the tropical fruit in this. Quite the tasty tripel! Allagash is definitely my favourite for Belgium styles! A touch of sourness can be noticed, similar to a grand cru. Palate is medium body, long dry finish. Nice Champaign like head with excellent lacing! Very good tripel that might even beat out many quads.

Pours a cloudy apricot color with a thin white head. Lacing remains on the glass after each sip. Yeasty aroma with a nice faint fruity scent. Bittersweet hop and fruit flavor. Crisp with enough carbonation to keep it light on the tongue.

Mostly clear yellow pour with some orange highlights. The aroma is Belgian yeast, orange, funk, honey. Sweet malt, nice spice palate with bitter orange, coriander, white pepper, and a musty yeastiness. The finish is mildly hoppy and clean. Very good Tripel.

Batch #106 -  Pours a clear dark gold with visible carbonation with thinner white head.  Aroma is faint but a hint of spice and malt.  Flavor isn¬ít overwhelming in any one area.  There is malt sweetness coupled with a spicy hop bite.  Alcohol does come in the finish as this warms but it¬ís to be expected.  The palate is very satisfying.   Finishes pretty clean.  A very nice brew.

Bottle @ Dan¬ís place, Denver. Pours dark yelleow with a small white head. Aroma of yeast, orangepeel, spices. Taste is sweet malty, yeast, fruity, lemon, orangelpeel, honey, grapefruit, light spicy. Medium body, lively carbonation. refreshing bitterness in the finish. 220212

From notes.  First reviewed 5/14/2010.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a tulip. Thanks to Flipadelphia for the sample.

This bottle pours a hazy golden color with a 4 cm frothy white head. A thin film remains and sheds some light lace on the glass.

Initially I get a strong whiff of straw, followed by a lighter honey and booziness. Perplexing; I would have expected more. As it warms, I get more honey and more alcohol, but still nothing special. 

Sweet honey pale malt hit the tongue up front, with a blend of spices (cloves, coriander, and a bit of pepper). Belgian yeast is also present. Herbal hops finish the off the flavor palette. Ok, but underwhelming flavor.

Above average carbonation gives it a crisp feel. Medium bodied.

Overall this really didn¬ít do anything special for me. Not really very complex or interesting.

Bottle @ Dan¬ís house. Fairly cloudy, light golden orange appearance with a white head. Big yeasty, lemon orange citrusy, spicy yeasty, tangy aroma. Delicious, orange lemon citrusy, spicy yeasty, lemonade, sweet malty flavor. Fuck yeah.
Nice fruity aroma, yes with banana and honey. Sweet/hoppy tast. Aftertaste is its most remarkable part.

Bottle pours slightly hazy straw color with a thick foamy white head. Aroma is banana, clove, and bread. Taste is banana, clove, a bit metallic, sweet and then hops come through on the finish to round it out. Body is medium, not boozy at all.  Overall, a delicious trippel. Good as anything from Belgium.

Bottle.  Translucent gold pour, almost opaque with an inch plus white head that recedes to white lacing.  Aroma is fruity esters and some honey.  Taste is fruity esters and alcohol. Body is medium and carbonation is high.

AR:  Banana bread and clove with hint of coriander.
AP:  Straw color with rich, white creamy head.  Pours two finger head that laces consistently upon drinking
C:  Hazy straw, squash.
L:  Hazy with bubbles throughout.  Very pleasant mouthfeel.
H: Rich and creamy starts with two fingers and slowly dissipates about half way through consumption.

Overall:  Wonderful Belgian abbey ale.  Flavors are balanced, rich, exciting and the appearance is very pleasing.  Great beer!
Pours honey colored with a good head.  Nice belgian smell with honey, crackers, citrus and hops.  Medium bodied with a good taste to go with the aroma.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden color with a half finger head.  Smells of herbs and a little bread.  Taste is smooth, somewhat dry, with some minor sweetness.  This has a delightful finish.. no alcohol on the tongue.  A great Tripel.

29-12-11 Bouteille 330ml: Tr√®s belle couleur jaune-blonde l√©g√®rement trouble avec reflets dor√©e. Mousse blanche abondante qui disparait tranquillement laissant une petite couche et collet. Effervescence moyennement vive. D√©licieux ar√¥mes de fruits tropicaux, de bananes, avec une touche de craquelin et de miel. L√©g√®rement sucr√©e, avec une moyenne amertume et une petite note surette en finale. Saveurs de fruits tropicaux, de craquelins sytle premium plus et d¬íune toute petite touche de miel. Corps moyen avec une texture ronde et enveloppante, mais l√©g√®rement croutillante. Bonne carbonisation et finale moyennement astringente, fruit√©e avec une touche d¬íalcool. Tr√®s bonne tripel.
Pours golden with a thick white head.  Smells of fruit and herbs.  Taste is mildly sweet with some sourness and bitterness.  Hints of honey and sour fruit.

750ml bottle batch 168. Had this a few times but thanks to David have a bottle to rate. Golden, hazy yellow with a billowy and creamy white head, at least one finger, that gradually settles leaving layers of lace stuck on the glass. Belgian yeast, sugar, grains, alcohol, coriander, banana. Fairly smooth but the alcohol lends a bit of a bite, slightly sweet throughout, some malt, banana and coriander at the end, becomes fairly dry. Quite nice but I think this is something that would benefit from sitting for a few months, maybe longer, for the alcohol to fade a bit.
Bottle, pours a nice bright yellow, aroma is nice and a bit of spice, this one is really quite nice, it doesn;t have alot of flavour but it works for the beer, its really nice, good offering
Nicely done tripel with clove and coriander notes. Average hops with herb and cirtus notes Had a better than expected malt body.

Bomber.  Pours hazy yellow with a large, dense white head.  Aroma is malty, floral, some citrus.  Flavor is malty, wheat/banana, some other fruit (maybe passion fruit, but I think I¬ím just impressionable), honey, some mild yeastiness.  Thick mouthfeel.  Lots of carbonation.  Alcohol is warming but well hidden.  Drinkable and delicious.
Slightly cloudy yellow. Faint banana aroma. Very light flavor as well, a little tart raisin I guess.

Pours a dense golden orange with a lingering white head and some lacing. 
Has a very fruity nose. Apricots, banana, pineapple. Lots of herbal and spicey notes and belgian yeast. Very enticing.
Taste has quite a bit of belgian yeast and spice. Coriander & clove. Some fruitiness as described in the aroma and honey for a welcome sweetness and an underlying hop presence all makes for a well balanced and exceptional tasting beer.
Medium to full body with a long dry finish with just a bit of both the sweetness and hop bitterness carrying through. Smooth with the perfect carbonation and plenty of warming alcohol. Really enjoying sipping on this one.

Fresh, grassy, yeasty aroma.  Big, foam-producing head.  Sweet and hoppy like a good tripel should be, with a drying hop finish.  It is lacking a bit in the orange and raisin flavors that I hope for in a good abbey brew.  Some dry, bready flavor and a little lemon peel too.  It is doing very well on the RB charts - the #3 tripel as of this writing - I think that is a little too high, but I am still a fan.
In tap Bridge View Tavern. Nice sleeky ropey pour with a thick head. Very nice top end featuring wheat, hops and lemongrass what lingers is almost bubblegum like. Nice lasting finish.

Bottle.  Pours a dingy yellow with a fair amount of haze.  Small head that dissipates quickly.  The taste is yeasty and sweet with a touch of hops.  The flavor is mid fruity.  This beer goes down smoothly and leaves a mild, pleasant aftertaste.  One of my favorite Abbey style beers so far.

Batch 141...pours a hazy orange with a medium white head.  Aroma has some candy sugary sweetness...some complex fruitiness...maybe mango.  Flavor follows suit with some subtle clovey spice...nice delicate bitterness at the end.  Mouthfeel is lively and the finish is dry and yeasty/fruity.  Very nice.

Bottle. Smooth pour hazy golden medium white head. Aroma of citrus, banana, floral. Taste is both medium sweet and medium bitter. Nice citrus flavor that is refreshing but not too sweet, good mix with floral and hops. Medium body, lively carbonation, long and smooth finish. I thought this was really really good overall.

GABF 2011.  Clear bright gold with a bubbly small head. Typical tripel aroma of Belgian spices like coriander, orange peel, a bit of cardamom, with a touch of Belgian barn funk. Bright Belgian yeasty flavor of light fruits like peach and funky pineapple, with a yeasty funk typical of the style, but very pronounced here. Chewy pale Belgian malt tone. A basic tripel, just a bit bigger.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a fine white head.  Aroma is yeasty with a hint of spice and citrus.  Flavor is sweet with hints of orange, yeast and spice.  Pretty good but a little too sweet.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Total Wine Sterling.  It pours a pale gold with a slight haze and a large, active, stark white head.  There seems to be a good bit of carbonation in this brew.  The nose is fruity and yeasty with notes of banana and honey as the description says.  The flavor features spicy yeast with a nice bit of clove, light honey, some banana, a little star fruit, and a slight bitterness on the end to help even things out.  Well balanced.  Rich but not thick or cloying with a good bit of carbonation to help things along.  A warming alcohol finish dries things out.  Nice brew!
Pours clear pale yellow with some head and little lacing. Nose is nice with belgium yeast and fruity aldehyde¬ís. Finish ids clean and slightly ketone fruity.

Bottle poured into tulip.  Amazing looking beer.  An iridescent hazy straw yellow color with notes of orange sit below a big 3-finger wide fluffy, marshmallowy head.  Thick lacing remains at top of the tulip.  Aroma is reminiscent of good tripels....complex and light at the same time with aromatic notes of spice, dark fruits, belgian yeast, perfume, banana, & champagne.  Beer is creamy and sticky on the palate with a nice soft carbonation.  Taste is downright astounding.  All of the aforementioned aroma qualities are represented in beautiful balance plus some honey, marmalade, and just a fantastic warm, boozey sensation to boot.  The spice on the sticky, longlasting finish is brilliant.  This is a near perfect beer. I only take off one point as the aroma is just the slightest bit underwhelming.  Allagash does it again!

Draught at Toronado. Yeasty pilsner malt nose, with citrus fruits. Sweet honey flavor, biscuity malt, prominent alcohol. Very fruity, and too sweet and boozy. Was good when paired with the boar sausage from next door, but very disappointing on its own, seeing how much I had been wanting to try this. Probably better in the bottle.

huge white head, stays, loads of retention, nice lacing, looks a bit soapy, lightly hazy golden... belg yeast, mild fruits, clean, loads of aroma, light tart, some light fruits, mild sweetness... medium lively, loads of fruits, lightly earthy, some mild spicing... medium to medium full bodied... lively up front, then a mild sweetness takes hold but leads to a lingering dry finish... excellent tripel, the only thing i discount is the earthy body...

Batch 170. Hazy golden color with a big fluffy white head. Nice lacing with a long lasting head. Nice spicy aroma, scents of honey, flowers, coriander,bready yeast. Has a nice smooth texture, creamy. Above average sweet flavor with a tart abby tripel finish. Flavors of caramel, spices, honey,yeast. A very nice tripel.

Beautiful thick, creamy & long-lasting head, nice lacing. Yellowish-orange clear appearance, fruity nose and exceptionally smooth & balanced mouth fell. Well balanced between hops and malt body. Wonderful finish, no sour or harsh notes at all, long lasting and pleasant aftertaste. A really great all around tripel ale, definitely a do again!

A year and a half to two year old bottle from Buff, thanks dude. The cap popped off crazy from the lighter. The nose has some nice funk, surprising and pleasant with sweet Belgian yeast notes after. The beer pours clear golden with a decent white head. The flavor is sweet and spicy, like Tripel should be with delicious sweet notes and yeasty sweet ending.

After all this time, I can¬ít believe I¬íve never rated this one. It¬ís a big, beautiful well made hazy orange beer with a big white fluffy head and lots of lacing afterward. Bready-spice-fruit aromas. Big and malty up front, but very smooth drinking.Gets better as it warms a bit. Long, complex bitter and sweet finish. Very well made.

On tap at Toronado.  Golden orange in color.  Sweet fruit eaters, apricot, light banana, mild spice.  Light, sweet malt, banana, clove.  Extremely smooth with a bit more residual sweetness than I would have liked.  Nonetheless, a good offering.

12 ounce bottle into goblet, no bottle date.  Pours hazy golden amber color with a fairly dense 1 finger white head with good retention that reduces to a fairly thick lacing cap.  Small amount of lacing clings to the glass as well.  Aromas of big clove, spices, grass, pepper, honey, and banana.  Nice aromas with good strength.  Taste of big pepper, clove, spices, banana, and grass; with some lemon, bread, and floral notes as well.  No bitterness present, but there is a fairly long finish with lingering notes of spice, pepper, banana, bread, and light fruitiness.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied.  Fairly thick and creamy mouthfeel.  Alcohol is fairly well hidden, only a decent amount of warming is present on the finish.  Very nice complex balance of all flavors, with good drinkability for the level of alcohol.  Overall, and excellent tripel with great complexity and balance.

750 mL bottle. Pours pale orange with a large white head. The aroma is lemons, bananas, orange peels, bread, coriander, and clover. Tastes very sweet, with some bitterness coming through in the finish. The palate is fairly heavy, grainy, and creamy. The aftertaste is a little bitter and long. Overall, this is an easy drinking and delicious beer. Lots of great malts and subtle hop profile, with a good yeasty esters.

Pours hazy orange with a fluffy white head. Smells of fruit and spices and hints of honey (that¬ís right, honey). Tastes of spices and honey, a perfect coupling of bitter and sweet. Medium-bodied with a sticky texture and present mouth-carbonation, Allagash Tripel Reserve finishes with an almost sickly sweetness that is almost made bitter from the spices.

Pours light and crisp from bottle with a half inch of white foam. Aroma has big fruit notes especially apple balancing out the spiciness of the alcohol. Robust taste full of fresh bread notes with a bit of fruitiness. It has kind of a dry finish to it.  A beer to luxuriate over.

750 mL bottle in a snifter.  Beautiful hazy golden orange pour with heavy head which slowly dissipates.  Slowly rising carbonation.  Almost closer to a quadrupel flavor.  Not as hoppy as other tripels.  Sweeter and smoother, but still incredibly balanced.  Very refreshing and the high alcohol content isn¬ít as noticeable as with other tripels.
