Batch # 89. Pours a hazy light golden color with a medium white head.  The lacing was very thin.  There is a very noticable yeasty, malt scent.  The flavor is honey, malt and some banana with a clean refreshing finish.  Allagash is a solid brewing co.
Cloudy gold with a white head and spicy aroma. Flavor has a good amount of tripel fruitness and spice. Starts quite sweet but finishes dry and yeasty.

750ml.
$4.94
Sam¬ís Downers Grove

Batch #94

Allagash Tripel Reserve a hazy golden that turns straw when held to the light. Tiny carbonation bubbles rise quickly to the thin wispy white cap that sits up top. Really not much in the looks department.

The aroma makes up for the lack of appearence. Sweet rip peaches and tangerines start things off. Biscuity malts are faint and in the background. Hint¬ís of candi sugar come forward. There¬ís a zesty sweet snap in there from the tangerines.

Flavor is similiar to the aroma with ripe juicy fruits coming from every direction. Sweet tangerine zestiness up front with a mild dusty yeastiness. Candi sugar and mild alcohol come through mid palate but are quickly overtaken by juicy peaches on the finish. Very nicely done.

Lively mouthfeel with prickly carbonation and a zestiness that awakens the tastebuds. Each sip leaves me wanting another.

Easy drinker for the abv involved. Refreshing and tasty.

A solid offering from Allagash that has that X factor I can¬ít put my finger on but keep wanting more. Very nicely done.

5/19/07

Bottle in Westmalle glass.  Pours hazy orange with a lasting white head but not much lacing.  Aroma of sour/tartness like citrusy hops.  Sweet initial flavor with pleasant spicy finish  Medium-full bodied with excellent creamy mouthfeel and excellent soft carbonation.  A very good example of the style worthy of its Belgian counterparts.

A wonderful abbey tripel style ale, that I poured from a large bottle (marked "Batch #90") into a trappist glass.  It had a cloudy gold-amber color with a medium-sized foamy white head with average retention.  There was a strong yeast aroma, with alot of sweet caramel malt, and floral and fruity tones, with noticeable banana.  A background to the aroma of some earthy and herbal hops for balance.  The taste was sweet, with a slight wheatyness, and a touch of sourness underneath.  Surprisingly, there was practically no bitterness in this beer, and even the alcohol finish was sweet.  The body was somewhat thin, with low carbonation and light fizzyness, and a sweet wetness throughout, yielding to a slightly dry and warm alcoholic ending.  A great tripel ale, and a reasonable price, but packs a punch when taken at once.

this beer poured a beautiful deep gold with an orange hue into a Trappist glass, with a big rocky head.  aroma was full of fruity esters of banana and bubble gum, also a slight bit of honey and some spice in the background.   Flavor was subtle and complex, with the highlight being a note that on the back of the tongue resembled toast with honey.  flavor also had a light spiciness, and a bready yeastiness.  palate was medium but full with a medium amount of carbonation.  definitely one of my favorite if not my current favorite triple.

Bottle.
Clear golden coloured with a white head.
Aroma of fruits, spices and citrus.
Flavour of fruits, citrus and spices with notes of dried fruits.

Bottle. White creamy and very high and long lasting white head. Haz yellow body. "Muddy wateres"  aroma. I guess its barley ¬¥malt with a good deal of alcohold. Not very good though. Pretty sweet and fruity flavor for a tripel. Barley malt flavor with a fair amount of hops. Falvor much better than indicated by the muddy aroma. Feels quite linght in flavor in spite of 9% alcohol which is hiddenb i¬¥n a peasant manner. Far overpricen in Denmark though.
Bottle. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma is yeasty with malt and spices. The taste is sweet malty with spices and grass notes. Medium body with a sweet alcoholic finish.

Beautiful deep golden body with a beautiful white head; Beautifully elegant nose, very Belgium tripel like, deep and balanced; Huge soft textured body with a big soft carbonation, balanced; Long finish with lots of aroma that lasts very long. Great and very well made beer.

Bottle @ K√∏benhavnske √òldage 2007 in Copenhagen. Clear yellow / amber color with a average fizzy fair lacing mostly diminshing white head. Aroma is moderate yeasty, fruit, herbal / spices. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle at K√∏benhavnske √òldage 2007. Clear yellow - white head. A fulbodied tripel with all the right romas and tastes. Fruity, hoppy, citrus, flowery, licorice, yeasty, wheat, light sweetness. Dry finish. Medium/high carbonated.
Bottle. medium white head which didnt last long. Orange color. Smelled of yeast spice and fruit. A sweet beer with alittle bitterness as well. A very good beer

Bottle @ Copenhagen √òl Festival. Average fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Fair lacing. Cloudy orange color. Aroma of caramel, yeast, coriander, spice, clove and citrus. Medium to full bodied with an average carbonation and light hint of alcoholic texture. Flavor was sweet with some bitterness. Spicy sweet finish.

√òlfestival 2007. Bottled. Pours a clear light golden with a small white head. Rather sweet with aromas of perfume, plums and quite a bit of sugar. Medium bodied with an oily/creamy mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Fruity, dry finish.

750 mL bottle.  Hazy golden yellow with fizzy white head.  Aroma of citrus and spice with a hint of sourness.  Bright and lively palate - the carbonation is really wonderful.  Citrus, honey, and clove flavor with a crisp, sweet finish.

Nice fruity sweetness that does not become overpowering.  This is a great abbey tripel for the summer months.  Yeasty enough to remain crisp. Great looking foamy head. I like this one quite a bit, but too hard it¬ís often difficult to find outside of New England.
Pours a light copper color with a white fizzy head. Has hints of sweet fruits and spices. Has a carbonation that consumes the entire taste. Finishes sweet and clean.
Cloudy pale gold color. Very yeasty as a belgian shoud be. Cant figure out the spices, but definitely a banana flavor in there.

Cloudy golden/amber appearance with a medium size white head and decent lacing.  Yeasty, herbal, fruity aroma.  Multifaceted taste is spicy, moderately sweet, nicely hopped, with a plethora of fruity esters.  Medium-to-full bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel.  Dry, bittersweet, peppery, long lasting finish.

Peel the label off and it may be hard to convince me that this tripel is brewed in the US and not in Belgium, from the style of bottle to the cork to the taste. The beer poured honey colored and hazy with a good size white head. It is definitely active and effervescent. It smells of bananas, cloves and bubble gum. Tastes are wheaty and sweet with spices. As it warms there is a perfuminess to the taste foloowed by a candied sweetness and a honey like finish. Mouthfeel starts as crisp with a alcohol punch in the finish and as it warms it becomes more smooth and mellowed. Overall highly drinkable and dangerous.
Pours a clear golden color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is malty, banana, clove, and some fruit.  Flavor is malty, banana, clove, and a light dried fruit finish.

750 mL bottle.  Batch 94.  Pours an opaque golden with off white creamy head.  The nose is hard to pin down but I picked up a mix of malt, spice, banana, and bread.  The carbonation helps just a sip fill your mouth and the complex flavors are quickly overcome by a firm bitterness that seems a little out of place.  Overall a very drinkable beer that I¬íd recommend to others.  I¬ím not a fan of the tripel style but this had a better balance towards malt away from the high carbonation and dryness typical of other examples of the style.

Bottle. 750 ML.  Batch 92. Hazy, golden orange beer with frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, banana, wheat, and flowers.  Medium bodied with an oily texture, nice amount of carbonation, and a long finish.  Sweet flavor hides alcohol well. Well rounded beer.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2007 750ml bottle.  Poured a opaque, but not cloudy, pure gold color.  The smell reminded me of some hefeweizens, with its fruity nose, possibly orange or lemon.  It had a spicy initial flavor with bits of honey poking through as it rolled across the tongue.  Full bodied and leaves a strong warm, lingering finish.  Very nice sipping beer.

750 ml bottle thanks to Rob for the hookup on this one. Pours a clear cooperish golden color with a huge whiteish head. Aroma is yeasty with spices, pepper and hint of banana notes. Flavor is the same and very smooth and drinkable. Exceellent Triple.

(Bottle) Pours a clear golden color with a huge, long lasting white head. Excellent lacing as well. Sweet aroma, with a peppery character. Taste is pretty complex, with some spice and citrus. Yeast and some alcohol were also in the flavor. Smooth from start to finish... with a pretty good mouthfeel, but not that impressive. Overall, a very good beer that definitely met my expectations.

Bottle.  Golden pour.  Aroma of bananas and yeast with some other spices.  Taste of hops, faint alcohol and malt.  Nice even finish.  Great tripel, and I am indifferent to this style so if it impressed me that¬ís saying something.

Bottle ; nose very yeasty, with some caramel, papaya, banana, and spiciness; lightly hazed yellow gold with a big white head; flavor very peppery, with light fruits and some coriander; body medium with some hop bitterness, alcohol, and pepper in the finish! Excellent! This must be from Belgium, It doen¬ít taste like Maine! (Just Kidding, I like the Bar Harbor Cadillac Stout a lot also!)

Bottle Light copper/golden pour with huge creamy head and great lacing. Sweet fruity malty aroma, some banana and citrus. Flavor has a bit more of a hoppy note, mainly in the aftertaste. Very well hidden alcohol. Sweet and smooth, very good brew.

750 bottle . . pours cloudy gold with a thick white head . . aroma is malt, bananas, citrus,  honey, spice, bubble gum . . taste is bubble gum, slightly hoppy, and a little bitter, yeasty, apricot, grapefruit aftertaste . . awsome beer!
Golden color with a good white head.  Smells like caramel, honey.  Tastes much the same, with some sweet and subtle flavors.  Very nice beer.

Very similar to DFH midas touch without as much wine character.  I really love the creamy almost mead like honey deliciousness.   A very awesome brew indeed that wins me over despite my usual preference for dark beers.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2007 Super dope beer. Everything I expect from a Tripel. Solid. I definitely recommend this beer.

The more I have of Allagash the more I think they may be the best brewery in America.  Pours clear golden / amber with a very large whitish head with very good retention.  The aroma has lots of Belgium yeast, light spice, moderate sweetness, white grapes and white pepper ~ excellent.  Medium body that is a bit thinner and more crisp than normal for the style.  There is a bit of slickness and lots of sharp stinging carbonation.  The taste starts with lots of peppery spice with some grapes and lots of thick earthy malt with very minimal sweetness for the style.  The finish has some of the earthy Belgium yeast and a bit of sourness with along with some spicy hops.   Big thumbs up  for this world class tripel that sure doesn¬ít taste like it was brewed in Maine.

Overrated a bit?  Another bottle shared with Hapjy - we were already a bit tipsy so I¬ím sure this wasn¬ít enjoyed to it¬ís fullest potential. Nevertheless, I don¬ít recall being too excited about this brew.  Too light and soft on my palate!  one and done.!

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2008 I felt that this beer was a little over-rated upon trying it, not bad though. I appreciated the aroma more than its other characteristics. Definitely light fruits, some ammonia, lemon and sweet banana. Good yeasty finish, but didn¬ít finish like a good Belgian-style. Stingy on the palate, with some spice that is not well-balanced with the dry alcohol finished. This is what turned me off. The initial flavor is nice, but the unsubtle finish was not something I was looking forward to after each sip.

On tap at Blind Tiger. Not as good as I was hoping. Aroma of clove, garlic, yeast. Flavor is strong, tropical fruity esters, yeast, bread, yogurt. Lively with candy apple finish. No head, cloudy mustard pour. This was much fruitier and not as dry as I like my tripels.

# 90 (batch?) 
Aroma: soapy, mellow, sourish in an almost lambiclike way...
malty & sweet below the surface, slightly funky. Some hops & lemonpeel, fried banana & cardamom. 
Appearance: pale, cold yellow w/ white head, slightly dim. Nothing special. 
Flavour: initial sourishness, almost meaty , bittersweet...raisinlike, full-bodied, yeasty... mmm, sourish caramel. 
Palate: wonderful! Powerful & champagnelike.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2007 Pours a clear orange blonde with a modest head.  Aroma is of fruit, caramel, grass, pepper and alcohol.  Flavor has residual caramel, yeasty notes,honey, and phenolic spice.  Moderate hop bitterness.  Nice and dry with a tart finish.

Verre de d√©gustation, provenant d¬íune bouteille de 750 ml avec bouchon de li√®ge, lors d¬íune soir√©e chez Glouglouburp. Ar√¥me: Odeur d¬íagrumes et de banane avec une l√©g√®re pointe d¬íalcool. Apparence: La couleur est blonde p√¢le voil√©e. Pr√©sence d¬íun moyen col mousseux et d¬íune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Go√ªt d¬íagrumes, de miel et de banane. Dur√©e moyenne de l¬íarri√®re go√ªt. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture l√©g√®rement cr√©meuse. Pr√©sence de c√©r√©ales en arri√®re go√ªt. (Rating #445)

Pours sligtly hazed tawny yellow w/ a full, semi creamy froth. Good head retention w/ a full canopy and a fluffy ring. Aroma of banana citrus and vanilla creamy malts. Medium nectar w/ soft residual effers. Texture is velvety. Malted banana citrus and creamy vanilla spice protrude w/ a mild sweetness. A persistant peachpit bittering component sets in at mid palate and sticks through to the finish.

This is a welcome tasting after recently trying Dicks Gran Cru (too spicy) and Rock Bottom MaryJane (too sweet). The other are good beers, but this one hits the nail on the  head. A beautiful pour, great aroma, exquisitely balanced taste, clean dry finish.

750mL bottle, Batch #88.  Pours a slightly hazy honey golden with a frothy three finger eggshell head.  Good retention.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, candi sugar, banana, citrus, pears, white pepper, and it¬ís a little bit musty.  Flavor is yeasty and fairly sweet and hot.  Everything else in the aroma comes through in the flavor.  Minimal bitterness with a dry finish that lingers with the yeast.  Full body with moderate carbonation and a fairly creamy body.  This was an excellent tripel.  Wish we could get more the the dubbel and white in Iowa.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: 25.4 oz bottle.  Batch 77.  Clear gold with a dollop of meringue and generous lacing.  Yeasty honey; lemon and sourdough bread.  Bubbly with a full mouth feel.  Heavy for a tripel.  Apricots, pepper and lemon zest.  Undertones of banana and melon.  Dry, clenching finish.  Oily on the palate.  Grows on you but still a chore to finish solo.

On tap at the Sharp Edge Creekhouse, thanks mtoast.  Allagash XXX , I¬íve been waiting to taste this. This beer pours hazy pale yellow but there are no precipitants within. Has a nice white creamy head but it also has some medium and larger bubbles that prompts an uneven foam. The aroma is mild, slightly sweet and lacking of the typical beery yeast aroma so common in today¬ís beers. Oooh, the initial flavor impact is quite strong, but not as strong as the 9% would indicate. Alky bitter on the beginning and alky bitter to the palate.  The alky content is certainly prevalent in this brew. Nice lacing on the sides of the glass as you drink. Tho this is above average bitterness, it is not quite as oppressive in the alky as that Southern Tier  trippel I recently had. Southern tier is much less refined than this brew, the Allagash lacks the in your face characteristic. The finish is medium high bitterness that can not be appreciated by my lager loving girlie taste buds. It reminds a little of bitter cough medicine. This brew does not stand a chance against white Chimay or Grimbergen Blonde. Slightly below par when compared to Victory Golden monkey as far as enjoyablity goes.  I¬ím not a real fan of trippels but since I have been spoiled by Chimay and Grimbergen, I now expect more from this style.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: UPDATED: APR 1, 2007 very nice hazy orange color. aroma is very much full of yeast, with some ripe fruit, in the background. Flavour is very yeasty with some citrus backdrop. lots of banana, and honey and a bit of clove, and a nice feeling on the palate. Carbonation is very nice, really smooth.......very nice beer.
Pours a hazy golden with a fizzy white head that disapates quickly. Aroma of fruit, Banana, honey. Tatstes of fruit, yeast. Sweet, well carbinated. I really like this!!

Pours hazy golden with a good head although the bubbles are a bit big and disapated quickly.  Aromas of tangerines, fruit, pilsner malt and alcohol. The flavor is of candy coated pilsner malt, little to no hop aroma or flavor, not enough hops to balance the sweet sticky malt.  Finishes malty sweet with not enough dryness on the finish, a bit cloying, not much else going on here, I did¬ínt even finish it to be honest.  Expected more from Allagash.
Batch 87.  750ml in a trappist glass.  Pours cloudy with a great white head.  Strong lemon aroma.  Very dry with a citrus flavor but still pulls off a sweet body.

750 ml bottle, batch 83, shared with StompBrockmore (his bottle) - pours a bright opaque honey colour, with the typical Belgian rocky head.  Awesome aroma packed with light citrus fruits, cardamom, yeast and some banana.  Nicely sweet as well.  Remarkably light in the mouth, and wonderfully balanced flavours of yeast, honey, passionfruit and some spice as well.  Delectable.  Lengthy, complex finish.  9% abv, but you¬íd NEVER guess it.  Great stuff.

A excellent beer. Aroma is a little sour with mild hops and lots of malt. Appearnace is light brown with a thin lacey head that lasts. Mouthfeel is carbinated with a smooth aftertaste. Flavor is excellent. Mild hops and malt are complemented with a hint of fruit and currants. A very nice brew. Oh by the way, i was part of batch #82.

750ml bottle, batch 83, shared with VeloVampire - pours vibrant, cloudy golden with a big rocky head on top. Light, fruity, citrusy, yeasty aroma that gives away not even a trace of alcohol. Flavour is full of banana, orange, and other citrus, along with bread, honey and Belgian candi sugar. Very light and delicate flavour. Not as robust as other Tripels, but that is not a fault here, and the finish is beautifully long and complex. It¬ís remarkable to me how light this is considering the high ABV, which reveals itself at no time. An extremely nice, American brewed Belgian ale.
Best beer I¬íve had in a while. Light and aromatic and manages to cover the high alcohol very well. I would drink this all the time if it were more inexpensive and accesible. Amazing.

750ml bottle pours a cloudy copper color, with a thick tan head, and descent lacing. Overall I was a little disappointed, with a 98 score, I was expecting more. A quality brew.
Batch #86

Hazey pale body with a large, beige head. The aroma is banana, clove, candi sugar and golden raisins. The flavor is bread, candi, honey, light banana and raisins with light sweetness. Medium body with moderate carbonation, slightly prickly, dense with just a touch of chalkiness on the finish. Excellent American brewed Belgian.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2015 Aroma, appearance were nice  The flavor was definitly a little sweet, maybe that of peach, but quickly gave way to an almost fermented fruit finish
Fruity smell.  This had very light and delicate appearance, with a very deep and complex taste.  I haven¬ít really had anything as deep as this in the color that it is.

This beer was dissapointing to say the least. After puring it the nose smelled like a budweiser. flavor was not in a triple profile at all. Alcohol was masked well, color was excellent. But bleh, never again...

At the 2007 Big Beer, Belgians, & Barleywines Festival in Vail. Pours thick hazy gold with a serious white head that does not last very long. Cotton candy aroma with light fruity flavors of banana and pineapple. Yeasty and medicinal palate. Very good domestic attempt at a tripel.

750 ML Bottle via dickinsonbeer(i think) and a few other traders (thanks!) Pours a semi clear amber with a small white head. Nose is candy with some fruity notes-apricot, peach, bananna. Tastes just like it smells with some belgian yeastiness and a sweet and sour finish. Full bodied and moderate carbonation. Triples are one of my less favorite styles but this is a good one.
I love this beer. Pours a pale gold. Nice carbonation and frothy head. Smells of Belgian yeast and banana spice. Flavor is subtle and spicy. A deliciously well-balanced triple from Maine.

750ml bottle, batch #73. Looks great, smells great, on first few sips tastes great, but the alcohol comes through in a huge way a short while in. I know tripels have a higher percentage than most, but it really comes through on this one. To style, just a little hot.
750 ml botle.  Pours a murky yellow with a slight head.  Citrusy aromas.  Light mouth feel with citrus flavors.

750 mL bottle. Pours gold with big white head and lots of bubbles. The aroma is zest, clove, honey, banana, and a hint of pepper. The flavor is banana bread with lots of autumnal spices. Warm finish and aftertaste. I am very impressed with the smoothness and balance of this one.

Brickskeller, Russian River / Allagash Lovefest.  Pours a medium golden appearance; white head with excellent lacing.  Soft, yeast aroma; plenty of coriander, floral notes, and candy sugar.  Medium carbonation; medium, chewy mouthfeel: candy sugar, yeast, and honey character.  Medium, sweet finish; much sweeter than most tripels I¬íve had.

This beer is soooo good.  A bit of clove and honey as good as any Belgian that i have had in the past year.  Well worth the money I paid.  Just the beer to finish out a cold winter night.  Though it is still early in the year, my new number one.

Batch #81. Pours a hazy yellow with a cream colored foamy head, lasting, slowly revealing nice lacing. Aroma is very fruity, apples and pear with subtle notes of clove and all-spice. Heavy body with strong spiced-honey flavor, very warming. Not overwhelming. Ahh, very refreshing on this cold winter night. Bit of a dry malty aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2007 Batch 88, Tulip glass, Poured a hazy gold color with a nice white head. Strong aroma of fruits. Tastes of spices, fruits and some yeast.  Nice smooth finish.  I loved this Tripel.  Rivals alot of great belgiums.

Big thanks to ( porterhouse ) for this one. 750ml bottle. Batch 84. Poured into my Tripel Karmeliet glass. Pours a hazy medium gold with big three finger white head. Wicked sticky lacing. Aroma is big time Belgian. Nice malts and spices. Big yeast, malt and spice flavor. I love this style. So damn tasty. Time to go watch 24 now.

I am increasingly amazed at the quality of American Made craft beers. I find the Allagash Tripel Reserve an excellent beer and a rival of of many of the top rated imports.  It pours a nice cloudy amber with a big foamy white head. It has a nice crisp spicy flavor with a delicious flavor I don¬ít find much of an aroma but I don¬ít think that takes too much away from the beer
Bottle. Hazy yellow with white head. Aroma: Coriander and citrus. Carbonated. Flavor: Sweet, spices. Low bitterness
UPDATED: APR 2, 2007 Clear amber body with a medium creamy white head. Sweet caramel aroma. Light caramel and fruit flavor with some light yeastiness.

Batch 82.  I liked this quite a bit.  The cork had a licorice smell to it so I didn¬ít know what to expect.  Pours with a nice fluffy head.  Flavor is typical Belgian style, as is aroma.  It¬ís fantastic, but not unique.

Cloudy pale golden color with a thick eggwhite head.  Aroma of fruits and spices along with a pleasant sourness.  Taste is smooth, crisp, and tart.  Yeast and sweet malt flavors are evident as well, all balanced nicely.  For a 9% ABV, alcohol is well hidden, except for the post-swallow warmth.  This is definately a quality tripel.  Certainly better than most imports, and even the domestic Ommegang (which is pretty damn good).  Nice job, Allagash!

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2007 My second foray into Allagash territory proves to be quite a wonderful delve into flavor land indeed. I don¬ít recall the batch number, many drinks followed, perhaps it was 83 or 88? Anyway, pours gold/orange with a medium off-white head. Aroma is wonderful spices, fruits, banana in particular, and yeastiness. Flavor was much the same, but very floral, not in an overtly hoppy way though. The alcohol makes its self known, but only mildly.

June 2005, 750ml bottle (batch 66), consumed New Year¬ís Eve 2006. 1.5 years old. Bright orange pour with a lot of bubbles and a thin white head of soapy bubbles. Aroma is floral and sweet with a touch of alcohol. Flavor is very well blended, citrus, flowers, sweet candy.  Slightly dry finish. Very nice quality tripel.
Batch 77 - aged about 8 months after purchase. Clear golden with a quickly fading white head. Very nice sweet spicy banana aroma and flavour. It¬ís weak point is a long rough spicy finish.

This opaque pale golden ale poured with a strong lacy head. The flavor is citrus-laced, with unresolved (residual) sugars, resulting in a fairly bitter finish and minimal carbonation. Would probably be better to age a couple years.
Cloudy golden body with with big foamy white head.  Aroma of fruit, yeast, and spices.  Slightly sweet flavor with strong yeast and citrus hop character.  Quite spicy on the finish.

Aroma of yeast, banana, light citrus, honey and floral.  Light yellow in color.  Medium frothy white head.  Alcohol fairly present at the beginning, mellows with time.  Taste complex, similar to aroma.  Carbonated, with a nice body.  Good beer.
Very nicely done belgian here. The focus is a delicious smooth sweetness and great drinkability. The alcohol is put into the background do to a well crafted beer.

This is a terrific tripel that stands up to many of the great Belgian tripels.  Aroma and flavor of banana, yeast, malt, citrus and spice with a nice hoppy, bitter finish.  Nice foamy head that doesn¬ít disappear.  Very well done.
A very fruity beer, light in color, but nothing else.  The flavor is a very fruity mix, as is the aroma.  I enjoyed this beer, and I think fans of the belgian ale will as well.
user_location: The United States of Texas, Texas, USA

text: Pours light cloudy honey. Full white head. Smells of abbey ester goodness, but not a strong aroma. Fairly dry, malty fruity flavor.

Bottle.   Pours a cloudy straw color with a full off-white head, decent lacing.   Aroma is citrus, spice, yeast, pepper.   Flavor is banana, clove, yeast, alcohol.   Palate is medium bodied, spicy, dry, highly carbonated.   This is the one that got me into craft beer.

This is one of the best beers I have had all year. Amazing citrus and spice in the nose and beautiful bubblegum and pear notes.  This is dry, not cloying but sill full bodied.  A real feat in brewing, this is a wonderful beer!
This beer is super.  The aroma is amazing, other than that, the commecial description is right on.  Easily one of the best tripels in the US.

Batch 77 bottle.  Cloudy yellow/orange with a frothy off-white head leaving spots of lacing.  Tart yeasty bread aroma with spice, banana, flowers, and citrus.  Bittersweet cakey malt flavor with a lot of orange peel, coriander and pear notes throughout.  Warm bitterness on the finish.  Some dusty black pepper in the aftertaste.  Mostly smooth palate with slight carbonation.  Very good, probably the best American tripel out there.

Batch 81.  Pours a clear gold with fizy white head.  Aroma of citrus, spice, orange, and sweet malt.  Flavors of spice, banana, orange, some grass and peppery notes, and a bit of hops.  I enjoyed the four much more.

Batch 85.  Pours straw-gold with one-inch white head that fades to a cap and laces heavily. Opaque, large amount of yeast.  In the nose:  lemon, coriander, orange peel, slight peppery spice.  Taste: pronounced malt sweetness, heavily spiced, small amount of citrus, some honey as advertised, finishes indistinct, slightly bitter.  On the tongue, well-rounded, high carbonation but thick.

750 ml bottle from Thiachilie.  Batch 78.  Really a wonderful beer.  Pale gold with a beautiful snow white head.  Loads of lace.  Pretty complex aroma.  Citrus, spice, dish soap, pepper.  Pretty much all of that in the flavor as well, along with a nice candi sugar sweetness.  Full on the palate, with a nice bitter finish.  Paired well with my Thanksgiving dinner.
Bottle. Batch #75. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a white head. Malty yeasty aroma. Malty flavor with spicy hints and hints of yeast. Long malty finish with some hints of yeast.

Pours honey with an off-white, creamy head.  Aroma of warm spices with pleasant hop bouquet.  The flavor is of alcohol at the front, followed by an amber malt and a tinge of hop bitterness.  Quite a bit of alcohol heat, full body, clean finish.
Batch 71. 22oz bottle Medium gold in color, thick, billowy head that leaves a nice lace all the way down the glass. Banana, clove, orange scent. Smooth, with an alcohol bight in back. Nice beer.

Sampled from 22 oz. bottle. Distinctly different from the Dubbel. Orange peel and coriander burst out of the nose. Color is just a shade darker than a pilsner, may be even be a tad lighter than the dubbel. Taste is orangey and grainy. Any extra sugar in the brew is not too apparent, as there¬ís a well hidden hop balance to keep this enjoyable. Alcohol is also very well hidden, so be careful with this one.
excellent beer...22 ounce bottle from new world brewery...batch 84...nice mixture of sweet and sour fruits and spices...fluffy head, golden color...faint taste of alcohol...mmmmm

750 ml Bottle. thanks to J.P. for this bottle bringed from U.S.
Cloudy blonde with a creamy head. Aroma fruitiness with some underlying spice. Medium body. not the best of this style, but not bad.

Batch 66. Cloudy, golden body with large, soft white head. Big and inviting aroma of spice and fruits ¬ó clove, passion fruit, orange, banana. Multiple flavors emerge from a flowery bitter backbone, ripe sweet fruits, clove, honey, pepper. Medium body with smooth, creamy palate that seems to be a hallmark of Allagash. Sticky and long, dry finish. Warming alcohol. Outstanding.

I was very impressed with this beer, from start to finish, and if I can find it, I will purchase it again.

The packaging was a large, cork-sealed single serve.  Even before I opened it, this beer demonstrated a significant amount of sediment.  I hung onto it for several months before drinking.

Poured a hazy gold with abundant white head (appealing).  Odor was floral citrusy, and pleasing, but not outstanding.

Flavor was very good and the highlight of the beer...there was a grapey chardonnay sweetness balanced with a wine-like sourness.  There was no hop content and limited malt flavor but the flavor was very good and (to my limited knowledge) very appropriate for the style.  I was impressed with this beer and plan on having it again, when it¬ís once again available to me.

A 22-ounce bottle, purchased at Jungle Jim¬ís in Cincinnati, reportedly "Batch 77."

Hazy light yellow with frothy white head. Decent lacing. Spice nose with honey and some yeasty pear and banana notes. Good taste with much the same as the nose. Finish is nice and long with pepper. Get a bit of a film on the tongue after 1/2 the bottle, but doesn¬ít bother me at all since this is a great beer.

Pours hazy yellow/golden with a frothy white head. Aroma of mild spice, hints of banana, honey, yeast, and some mild spice. Flavor is has some light hints of honey, mild spice, yeast, tropical fruit, banana, and a very slight bitterness. Palate is medium, long, effervescent, mildly spicy, honey sweetness, and lots of yeast. Fairly complex, and very enjoyable.
A very nice aroma and a really tasty creamy head. A different triple, in that it¬ís not all that spicy, but quite excellent. Would definitely have again.

Straw colored pour small white head, belgian yeasts some nice light pepper notes and bread dough make up the aroma.  Palate is full well coated and lightly creamy.  Sweet almost honey on bread flavor w/ some very sweet light fruits.  Good.
Pours out a nice cloudy amber color with a huge white head.  Aroma is sweet and yeasty.  Flavor is superb.  Has a great yeast hit and finishes with a fruity hint.  Over all a very good brew.

Excellent, beautiful beer (batch #80): Poured a golden, but slightly cloudy, wheat with a wonderfully thick and creamy white head. Aroma was swet and yeasty, mouth was pefectly pleasant, with a slight bite. Flavors are typical strong Belgian ale. Very, very nice!

Corked bomber. Batch 64. Pours a milky hazy golden with a nice fluffy white head. Nice looking triple. Yeasty aroma with strong notes of banana with a hint of spice. Initial flavor is very fruity, I pick up banana and pear with a nice medium sweetness. Finish is dry and peppery. As it gets warmer, the white peppery hotness really hits the back of the mouth. Very solid triple from Allagash, and moderately priced too. I¬íd drink this again.

Bomber.  Pours a orange haze.  Aroma is very yeasty, with oranges, some spice, and maybe a hint of bubblegum.  Flavor is once again very yeasty, with the spice coming through.  Mouthfeel is a bit thin, with a tad of carbonation coming through.

Bomber - Batch #82 - Pours a hazy golden yellow in color with a whitish head that fades to a thin covering over the beer.  Aroma is characteristically Belgian with fruit (green apple is accurate), honey,  and lots of yeasty goodness.  Flavor is classic Belgian yeast with a spicy, but mild hop bitterness.  Body is a bit less than I would have expected.  Little evidence of alcohol.  Finish is yeasty and nicely hoppy bitter... medium length.  A very good beer and one that I *will* repeat....

UPDATED: APR 8, 2007 On tap at Barcade. Pours a pale golden, with a white film for head. Has a nice tart fruity aroma. A bit sweet & viscous. A touch of green apple and raspberry, and a little yeast. The flavor is pretty good, but seems somewhat syrupy, or artificial in some way. Not enough dryness for a Tripel.
Batch 77- Hazy yellow colored body with a thick white head. Cream taste and no after taste.

Thanks Kevin!  The beer pours to a very hazy straw yellow colored body with an airy frothy white head.  Decent lacing.  The aroma is clove honey, nice interesting herbs, pomegranate and orange rinds.  Very nicely balanced.  The flavor is nicely toasty with a delicate balance of honey, banana, toasty grains, nice!  The palate is smooth, good texture.

Cloudy yellow body, not much head.  Spicy nutmeg / molasses cookie aroma - appealing.  Smooth, cohesive flavor - more spicy clove/nutmeg over soft, minerally pale malt accented by green peppery hops.  A damn fine tripel - I usually don¬ít enjoy these.
foamy head --- herbal even body - a good beer for entertainment -- a weaker body though definately not a ASL (american shitty lager)

Golden color, medium head, medium carbonation. Aroma of citrus and honey. Flavor is mostly sweet, a little spicy (pepper) and slightly bitter. Fortunately, the spicyness grants it some complexity. As for other Allagash, I find the body a bit thin and watery. Nevertheless a good tripel.

Batch 77 - Whatever that means in terms of age.  Hazed sunshine yellow, big foamy white head with excellent lacing.  Nose was loaded with rich and complex tones of lemon meringue, fresh bread, orange zest, and honey, with underlying tones of banana and corriander.  The flavor integrates all the above into well balanced tones of spice, citrus, vanilla, and honey dipped bread.  ABV is well hidden.  Full bodied, soft smooth carbonation, spicy, refreshing finish.  Being not the biggest fan of this style, this one may have just changed my mind.  A great brew all around...

Gold hazy color ¬ñ white medium head ¬ñ nose of  honey , cream , yeast , elderberries , watermelon ¬ñ taste of malts , yeast , cereals , grains , bitter chocolates , sour apple   ¬ñ champagne body , dry style ¬ñ aftertaste slightly bitter , yeast , and malts

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2006 Not my favorite trippel, but any beer with a cork instead of a cap is going to be good.  Has a wonderfully pungent aroma.  Pretty stong, not as bitter as I would expect.  A little too hoppy for my liking in a trippel.  Overall, a pretty good brew though.

This was a nice treat--my first Allagash product.  Batch No. 36.  The pour was a very nice murky orange color with a small white head.  The aroma was incredible--I could¬íve kept this one in the glass just to keep sniffing at it.  Lots of soft fruit scents and some light honey as well.  The taste was similar with the addition of some faint spices and a definite caramel taste.  Nice even mouthfeel with a rather refreshing finish.  I¬ím heading back to get some more of this one!

From a fresh corked and caged bottle.

Pours a cloudy orange gold with a moderated head. The aroma is honey and orange peel, somewhat spicy, cloves and yeast. The flavor comes on with some sweetness but that is quickly undercut by a very dry tartness, slight wheat flavor, slight butteriness, maybe a tiny hint of soap.

This beer is very well crafted - impressively so - excellent in each of its componetnts. Yet for me, this beer lacks soul. The pieces are all there but it doesn¬ít come together as the sum of the parts.

(Bottle)  This is a very nice tripel, with a taste that mirrors the beer¬ís little brother the allagash white, with a nice citrus scent and taste.  Moreover the pleseant, not too alcholic after taste lingers, which is very tasty.  The cloudy appearance is consistent with the minimal filtering and helps keep the traditional belgian look.  Sampled at the Brewery.

Bottle Batch#78. Very pleasing tripel. Really quenches my thirst during these 100 degrees nights! Aroma is fantastic! Slight passion fruit but more of a monstera smell (look it up it¬ís a great fruit!) Look is perfect - great head, lots of activity, golden color. Very tasty. Can be a bit sweet at times and the alcohol hides well, it really does not show up on the taste. Well balanced with a good mix of carbonation but nothing too heavy. Very smooth finish and leaves the tongue and mouth happy and wanting more. Great tripel! Cheers!
batch 80.  orange and hazy pour with fine white head. smells faintly of lemons, with a more predominant floral and spicy aroma. Very pleasant and balanced flavor.

750 ml bomber.  Batch 66.  Pours a yellowish, light golden color with a medium sized bubbly white head that turns into a smooth coating rather quickly.  Aroma is of banana and spices with a hint of nutmeg and flowers.  Taste is a perfect balance of spices which include banana,nutmeg with a hint of honey.  Excellent overall and the alcohol is well hidden.

750ml bottle batch #68 @ 9%.Pours a hazy amber color with a little foamy white head.A complex spicey fruity aroma.There is no bitterness and a hint of honey with no alcohol taste.A well balanced brew that is a pure pleasure to drink.A true sensory experience.I will be getting more of this brew.

#39...hazy yellow-orange..low puddle of head...light floral spice whiffs...a change of pace here...very good stuff...a solid BOLD distinct bitterness, kinda peppery...alcohol is very well hidden...deserves its place...not over done ..just pure goodness in glass...

Pours a cloudy golden color with fairly thick head.  Aroma of citrus and spice with a bitt of alcohol.  Extremely smooth flavor and the alcohol is well hidden.  Not too sweet, nor too spicy.  Well balanced with a bit of breadiness.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy blonde  with a thick, creamy head that is long lasting.  Aroma is predominately fruitiness with some underlying spice.  Flavor really jumps out at you....more bitterness than I would have expected.  There is a fair amount of spicy phenolic flavor.  Alcohol is well hidden...there¬ís not even very much of the flavor I typically get with beers with a lot of candi sugar.  Medium body.  Overall, a very nice beer....not the best I¬íve had of this style, but it¬ís certainly close.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2012 (750 ml bottle, batch 69, from Downeast Beverage Co., cellared for 7 months after purchase) Pours a cloudy light apricot-yellow. About 1/2¬í¬í of white head recedes to a thin layer. Aroma of mild grapefruit and banana. Fine curtain of lacing on sides of glass. Mouthfeel dry, a little prickly. Flavor slightly winey, mostly light grapefruit and banana, a little gluey. Alcohol well-hidden. Finishes dry, leaves a light peachy-citrusy aftertaste. UPDATE 10/27/12: A recent 750 ml made me realize I had under-rated this. It¬ís great - spicy, sweet and a bit boozy. Pleasant alcohol warmth. Posted rating is an average of previous and recent rating values.

Finally, i decided it was time to try the Allagash available to me. A strong pressence of yeast decorated with spice, clove and banana. Immaculate looking gold with a soapy topping of head and plenty of lacing. The drink is quite rough on the palate with a fizzy and strong carbonation. Little notes of banana and clove found again but mostly a metallic flavor dominates over everything else.

(05.16.06) one pint, 9.4 oz brown bottle from DiCarlo¬ís, Mundelein, IL. Batch no. 62. 9% ABV. Poured hazy golden yellow with small white head. Soft carbonation. Fruity sweet malt aroma. Medium bodied Belgium-style trippel that starts with light malt sweetness and spicy (clove), intensely fruity (pear and kiwi) flavors. Very fresh and rich tasting ale with complex flavor character.  Finished dry with light spicy clove flavor fade.  Smooth. Complex character. One of my favorite Allagash beers.
A dry, heavy flavorful beer. Its rich flavors of malt and high AC content make this a perfect nightcap after a good meal. Smooth with mild fruit and spices.

The aroma is malty with plenty of yeast, herbal hops, and some fruit. The appearance is deep golden with some haze and a nice head. The flavor is very much like imported Abbey Tripels with the added bonus of not being overpowering (they do a great job of hiding the 9% ABV). It has all the elements from the aroma plus a nice dry finish. The palate is just about right. A well made beer. My only gripe would be the tiny bit of latex I am beginning to detect.

Bottled. Hazy orange colour, big orangeish white head. Fruits, sourness and weak alcohol in aroma. Flavour is fruits, weak alcohol and hops. It gets quite bitterish in the finish. Some hints of vanilla in aftertaste also. Refreshing, and the ABV is not disturbing at all.

kinda unimpressed.  i¬íve had plenty of tripels with more flavor.  boy, very little alcohol.  pretty balanced, my only complaint is simply that there isn¬ít enough going on.  it is, arguably, closer to belgian funk styles, but eminently drinkable

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2006 Westside Brewery has a "Wine Barrel Aged" version of this beer.  If it is in fact this beer, it doesn¬ít taste anything like it¬ís standard counterpart.  Well, something like it, except subtract the citrus, carbonation, and huge spicy finish and add a mellow, more alcoholic flavor with a tacky feel in the mouth.  BA  I would give this beer about a 4.2.  Very different......................................... Pale yellow color with a bubbly white head.  Aroma has heavy vanilla notes and a sugary creaminess.  Flavor is well balanced and has a bitter aftertaste.  Nicely carbonated but a bit thin in comparison to the creamy aroma.

Bottle. Hazy orange with a big creamy white head. Oranges, honey and spices in aroma. Fruity and slightly sweet flavour of oranges, spices, almond and honey with dry psicy undertone. Full, solid body: Dry peppery and grassy finish with undertones of oranges. Very nice trippel. Thanks MrWalker!

[Bottled, thanks MrWalker!] Hazy golden. Aroma of grass, honey and banana. Sweet, fruity and lightly yeasty with rounded mouthfeel and full body. Some peppery vinous notes. Grassy finish. Solid, but bit bold.

Batch 62. Poured a fairly pale yellow color with a small head that disappeared quickly and didn¬ít lace all that great. A little bit of a fingering along the edges of the glass, but not much else interesting. Pretty subpar for the style. Aroma was nice, spices and some citrus type smells. The flavor was of light citrus, some spices, some bitter orange rinds, and definitely yeast. In fact, this one was more bitter than many a triple, without the complexity of sweetness and other malty stuff going on behind the scenes, or in the early flavors. Alcohol came on strongly as it warmed, a little too warming. A nice beer, but somewhere between 50 percentile and 75 percentile examples from the style. Mouthfeel was thick and of average carbonation.

750ml. Batch #79. Fluffy white head that reduces to a persistent quarter-inch  of lingering foam. Plenty of lacing. Opaque orange liquid in the glass. Bready yeast in the nose with some orange and citrus thrown in. Mouthfeel is a quality I rarely feel compelled to comment on, but this one is great in the MF department. Taste is a fine combination of yeast and slightly sweet malt, citrus and something else kind of like wood or bark. Alcohol is obviously present, especially on the downtake, but is still mellow for a 9%. Really good stuff. I would imagine a year or two of aging would make this even better and maybe mellow out the alcohol a bit, but in its current condition, really very good.

rating #100. 750ml-Batch #77. Hazy orange, firm long lasting head, heavy carbonation.  Aroma: Lemon, Citrus, slighty sour fruit, earthiness and spicy. Taste: sweet malt, tart fruit, sweet lemons, tart and slightly funky finish.....

Served as part of a mini-Belgian tasting with some friends of ours. This was the first pour of the night. Banana, honey, clove, lemon, bread pretty much sum up this beer from nose to palate. I¬ím surprised that the ABV was 9, I was guessing more like 7.5. Its good stuff, probably one of the better Tripels around, but I was overwhelmed. A bit thin of mouthfeel as well.

750ml corked bottle .. hazy golden yellow color with a huge white head . very yeasty and spicy fruit nose. good citrus flavors .grapefruit ,apple ,lemon and pear.. good hop bite . balanced and a smooth dry finish. the alcohol is apparant but not overdone... good stuff

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2006 One thousand beers.  I drank this to celebrate the end
of my second year of law school on 5/17/06.  The beer
is cloudy orange.  Some sediment and a very large and
thick white head that laces my Kapittel glass.  This
is surely in the top of its class, and this bottle
from batch 32 has been aged for three years.  The cork
was very difficult to remove but the beer underneath
is in great condition.   It isn¬ít as soft and sweet as
Karmeliet, but more upfront with the alcohol and
fruit, as well as bitterness like Westmalle, but
significantly better than that beer.  Flavor has some
light fruit, mild sweetness, and alcohol.  The alcohol
is also in the flavor.  It doesn¬ít exactly help the
beer but the alcohol presence works this time.  Very
smooth on the palate.
Golden amber color with white head batch #19. Aroma was a grassy/fruit malt. Taste was a sour fruit with a malt finish of alcohol tingle.

En f√ªt au Brookline Publick House, Brookline, MA. Robe blonde tr√®s claire surmont√©e d¬íune mousse blanche √©paisse qui persiste. Ar√¥mes acres de levure, de fruits et de sucre. Saveurs sucr√©es de fruits rouges, de banane, d¬íabricot et de levure.

750ml corked bottle, batch #77. Cloudy golden with huge white head. Aromas of green grass, dry hay, lemon, grapefruit, light malt, chalky bubblegum, spicy pepper, yeast, metal, and some funkiness in the background. Flavors follow, incredibly well balanced, with a yeast-focused bite throughout. Alcohol is completely hidden. Really fantastic stuff, wowzers!

From 750, batch 72.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with thick white head.  Nose is yeasty/doughy with spices, light fruits like tangerine and melon.  Flavors follows nose with a nice epervescent palate and a touch of alcohol noticeable.  Very lively on the tongue.  My favorite triple.

Batch #77.  Gigantic white head leaves plenty of lacing.  Aromas do not disappoint, either.  Spice box, lemongrass, rosemary, mint, and a healthy backing of grains and hops.  Wonderful, hop bite of orange, lemon, prune, honey, and a grassy, woodsy finish.  Drying finish where some alcohol is apparent, but it is obvious, intentional, and welcome.  Lasting palate.  Hallelujah!  Great tripel.  Can¬ít believe this is American.
A great fruity beer.  For a 9% beer you would think it would be stronger, but it tastes so damn good.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2006 Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of belgian spices, citrus, and fruit. Flavor is smooth, carbonated, sweet, fruit, citrus.

750 Batch #70. Thanks to Jhop for the bottle. Pours a nice golden brown with a small, white head. Aroma is of malts, yeast, spices and fruit. Apples and some pear..Flavor is nicely balanced I think. Malts, spices, slight hop taste, with some fruits (grapefruit) and some spices. Nice on the palate. Full body with a small amount of carbination. Finish with a yeasty aftertaste. Overall a very nice Belgian Tripel. I shall have to get a couple and age them for while.

I¬íve wanted to try this for some time, as I love all the Allagash beers I can get my hands on.  Aroma was sweet and quite fruity.  Nice lasting head with great lacing.  This is a nice crisp tripel with a fruity taste to match the aroma.  Surprised that there was very little yeast when I emptied the bottle.  One can feel and taste the alcohol warmth.  Overall, a great tripel that could get better with a little age on it.  I got my hands on a case, so I hope to taste one of these every six months or so.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2011 Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy pale yellow-golden color with an enormous foamy white head that lingered and produced good lacing. The aroma was sweet table sugar, pear and a touch of apricot. The flavor was dry and herbal with notes of table sugar, passionfruit and noticeable alcohol. The finish was long and dry with faint sugar lingering. Fairly full bodied. Ok.

batch 73. not too shabby but not off the meat rack. smells like salami. a little thick and a bit chalky in the mouth. not very much spice.  a little hay a little bubble gum very well balanced but i think the flavors are a little too subtle

WHOA! Whereas most tripels are dry and uninspired this is fantastic.  Pours opaque gold.  Aroma is candy sugar sweet and a little earthy.  Flavor is, again, candy sugar but not overwhelming...earthy grass hops...moderately bitter.  Other than Alesmith, I don¬ít think I¬íve ever had a more balanced tasting beer.  This is truly the best tasting Belgian any-style ale I¬íve had and one of the best overall.  I think it was like $7 for 750ml too...excellent.  For a while I¬íve been on the short end of the Allagash selection but this is truly a fantastic beer.

Whereas others found the drinkability and rounded subtle palate a bit ho-hum I rather enjoyed it.  Yeasty ,citrusy ,and a hint of dry chalk.  A beautiful pour of cloudy golden, and pale orange with the ubiquitous huge white head that a tripel delivers.  I agree it is mellow and wihtout presence of alcohol but I found that more refined and appealing than boring.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2006 Batch 69.  Pours bright gold into a tulip.  Nice medium head with lacing as it reluctantly and slightly recedes.  Earth, hay and banana notes.  Strong alcohol presense.  Full mouthfeel.  Lingering alcohol finish.
Bottled. Pours a hazy medium orange color. Slightly sweet aroma, mildly yeasty. Very creamy mouthfeel. Strong yeasty flavor. Lighty fruity flavor, some grain. Full flavor and body.
Very nice beer, although I agree with the other reviewer that La Fin du Monde packs more in the taste dept. Can¬ít go wrong with this though, I¬íd be more than happy to have a few more.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2006 750ml bottle (Batch 84) from A-1 to-go in Gardiner... Murky orange-yellow body with a finger or so of off-white head.  Smells mostly citrusy/orange peel with some spice also evident.  Tastes sweet, citrusy, and spicy.  Remarkably well-balanced.  Alcohol is somewhat evident, but is very well-hidden.  Fairly full in body.  Very drinkable and enjoyable.  And at 6$/bottle, it is a steal for sure.
750 ml-Nice golden color with a great head. Very spicy with hints of honey.

750 ml bottle batch 73: Good tripel. OK aroma with citrus peel and yeast. Nice agreeable flavor of mellow orange and coriander with spices. A very drinkable palate and no indication of alcohol. This was good but a little boring. I¬íve definitely had better.

Aroma:fruity,yeast.....
Appearance:light hazy gold,small head....
Flavor:fruity,lemon,yeast......

I¬ím changing my tune a bit on this style.  This one.  Honey is very apparent.  Spicy orange aromas.  Very smooth at first drink.  Well balanced, full bodied.  My only complaint is that it has a little too much head.  I know some people like it but it gives me the burps.  Finish is a little tart on the back of my throat.

750 ml bottle.  Batch 71.  Light golden yellow body with a small white head - this looks like a glass of champagne.  Aroma of lemon and yeast.  Flavor is similar with a surprisingly nice honeyed sweetness.  Very crisp palate.

Bottled.  Batch 67.  POurs a rich, golden color with a slight orange hue.  White head that fades into heavy lacing.  Slightly phenolic aroma with some fruitiness and spice.  Spicy and sweet flavor.  Warming at the end.

Batch 71, thanks drewbeerme!  Pours bright bubbly gold with big lacy head.  Strong aroma of fruit and spice--peaches, nutmeg, orange.  Tastes like it smells, big and fruity with lots of tang and yeast, candied orange peel, grapefruit, orchard fruits, more nutmeg and coriander.  Loved the long sweet yeasty finish.

Batch 62. better then some of the other Allagashs i have had. Poured a pale yellow color with an okay head that didn¬ít lace as well as this style should. Aroma spices and citrus. Flavor was of same spices orange and strong yeast. Mouthfeel was a little think. Good but this is a tought style to be top ten in."

Draught at Tyler¬ís in Durham, NC.Slightly hazy dark golden color with bubbly white head that laced the glass. Malty, citrusy nose (mostly oranges) with apples and spice. Sweet up front with honey, fruit, yeast, and candy flavors. Finishes with a tangy apple note and a dash of alcohol. Very tasty.
I¬íve been able to land this one any where from $6.99 to $8.50 for a 750 ml, It may not be the best tripple I¬íve ever had, but it¬ís really good and for that price, it¬ís the best deal around.

750 ml bottle Batch #65.  Poured copper orange with really nice head that stuck around to see the finish.  Aromas were sweet, pear, and other fruit.  Flavors were a bit drier with some pepper and a touch of hops.  Finished dry too.  Pretty good stuff.

Botte-Batch #  Poured a cloudy yellow-gold with a medium large froathy head.  Aroma was overwhelming sugary citrus smell with a small amout of hops hiding underneath.  The flavor was of yeast mixed with citrus.  Lacing lasted throughout the drink.  It certainly didn¬ít seem like a 9% alcohol, as the alcohol was not noticeable at all.  Wonderful, wonderful stuff!

bottle. thanks for sharing, Len. the pour is light orange-yellow with a frothy white head. aroma consists of liberal spicing, sugar, alcohol, pears, peaches, and cereal. straightforward flavour as Tripels go. alcohol warmth with sweet fruit flavours and a soft bready texture. a good bitterness bite towards the dry finish. good stuff.

Sweet, spicy vanilla, and fruity aroma - flavor is of spice, bread, tropical fruit, vinous alcohol, and malt -definitely a full on tripel-allagash puts out consistent quality and this is definitely a strong offering

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2006 WOW! My new benchmark for all Belgians has arrived. Batch #72 was quite refreshing. Beautiful lacing. A myriad of complex fruit and spice in its aroma as well as taste. Warm and Soothing finish that leaves you awaiting the next sampling. This is IT  for Belgians. What are you waiting for ..... Get some ALLAGASH Tripel Reserve TODAY!!!!!!!

Bottle courtesy of IMMY, thanks Tim!  Moderately cloudy, pale yellow body with a creamy looking, blecahed cloud. Fruits and spice are upfront in the nose, citrus rind, with yeasty esters, and a warming alcohol aroma. Sweet yeasty flavours are complimented by plums< bready corriander, and oranges. Very good. Warming alcohol finish, creamy, and smooth. Very good. Thanks Tim!

Bottle batch 40. Pours a hazy amber with a large creamy head that lasted and produced excellent lacing. Good complex spice and fruit aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Very good refreshing sweet banana and fruit flavor with a small alcohol tone finish of long duration. Another very good Allagash brew.

Pours bright and carbonated with a rocky white head. Aroma of black pepper mingled with fruity esters. Starts crisp and spritzy but finishes long and sweet. Honeyed pear, yeast, minerals and banana in the flavor. Has a spicy zing that stays on the tip of the tongue. Nice.

Obtained in a trade with Illinismitty... thanks!!  Pours a slightly cloudy yellow color with a medium head and tons of super sticky lacing.  Aroma is like apple cidar with a slightly sweet/sticky hop hint to it.  Flavor reminds me of apple sauce with a barrel of bananas and cloves thrown into it (weird, i know).  Very smooth and lingers on the palate.  Not a fan of tripels or Allagash, but I really enjoyed this one

The aroma is citrus/spice.  The taste is on the sweet side, with a citrus-banana-yeast combination that serves well to smooth out the alcohol taste.  Something still separates this from a true Belgian, or maybe it¬ís just the knowing that it¬ís not - I¬ím not sure.  Anyway, a very good beer - can¬ít wait to taste their others.

Thanks to egajdzis batch #37.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with a small white lacing head.  Aroma of caramel malts, citrus, floral and a littel spicey with some yeast.  Flavor was sweet and creamy with some yeast and lighter Belgian spices and yeast.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2007 bottle. This tripel pours a cloudy off-yellow with an aggressive white head. The aroma is strong of fresh barley, highlighted with dried apricot and sugar. More cloves and spices become apparent in the flavor It¬ís soft, some honey, and bright lemon notes are there. The finish is excellent and tangy. 

[Nov 16. 2007]------- in a blind tasting. I was sure I would pick this out as my favorite in the tasting and I did. It¬ís noticeably hoppier aroma with strong hints of pineapple and citrus was unmistakable. This is yeasty and mildly spicy with flavors of honey, banana, and cloves. This is vibrantly sweet with reasonable carbonation and a spiced finish. This is juicy, nicely hopped, and definitely my favorite beer in the standard Allagash lineup.

Damn, i really love this beer. Its even better on tap. Had it in both forms very recently and I wish I had an endless supply of both. As good of an imitation Tripel as you will find in the USA. La fin du Monde of Unibroue up in chambly, canada also has a great one. thanks again, rob!

Hazy gold with a lasting largfe white head. Bread, cloves and fruit esters apparent in the aroma. Yeasty flavors accompanied by bananna with an underlying sourness that extends into the finish. Refreshing and quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2006 New impressions...this is the best tripel on the planet
***
This beer was damn good.  Shared a pitcher of it with two buddies at sharpedge.  Pours golden orange with a thick cream colored head...some nice lacing too.  Smells of spice and vanilla.  The taste is also of spice and vanilla, but it has a lot of sour fruity qualities.  The mouthfeel is unbelievably smooth and rich.  I¬ím not the biggest fan of tripels, but this may be one of the better ones I¬íve had.  I¬íd drink this over the westmalle and chimay tripels in a heartbeat.

Hazy gold pour with new fallen snow head of 3 fingers or so in my Chimay chalice.  The aroma is floral, spicy, and citric with some fruit notes.  The taste is spicy floral, hoppy, and citric up front, with some fruitiness at the finish.  Well balanced and complex, this is a standout beer.

Beautiful cloudy golden color with a rich cream head.  Nice spicy aroma with sweet, sugary fruit.  Some sweet tangerine and honey flavors with loads of spice.  Finish is clean and mellow, the alcohol is hidden quite well.  Delicious.
Pours golden with fluffy white head. Nose is fruity and a little sour. Taste is crisp and fruity and a little sour. Has a nice clean finish.
Batch 53.Cloudy golden yellow. Aroma is spicy and spicy and spicy,oh and maybe basil and tons of exotic fruits. Heaven.More fruitiness that spice which suits me just fine.Like eating a fruity sorbet.

Batch 63- A deep golden color, very effervescent with a cream colored foamy head.  The scent is mild Star Apples and Tangerines with fresh herbs. A sweet front with cotton candy and melon flavors, a warm alcohol middle with black pepper and floral hops. Has a lingering bitter finish and aftertaste and feels a bit sticky on the lips. Even though it isn¬ít my favorite style, I did enjoy this well made Triple. Thank you Santa FooFaa!

Tall fluffy white head, clear golden body. Typical tripel aroma of fruit, yeast and hay, rather mild. Light malty and yeasty flavor with some spices and a dry mouthfeel. Somewhat perfumed. Drinkable, but uninteresting.

Pours bright golden-yellow with an immense white head. Yeasty, fruity nose. Slightly sweet palate with balanced hop bitterness. Clean, estery finish with lots of body and a hint of banana and spice. Almost vinous. Lots of character and very well-balanced overall. Great Tripel!

Excellent beer.  Pours cloudy gold with a billowy white head and lots of carbonation.  The aroma or fruits and yeast, and very sweet.  The taste is outstanding.  The malts and sugars really stand out, but don¬ít overwhelm each other.  A very balanced beer that I will definitely have again.

This one poured great! Nice carbonation. Color is good, suprised it was cloudy.
Good yeast characteristics, lacks in the malt.
I will be buying this one again!
Batch 60

I love this beer. pours a cloudy golden color, with thick whittish head. nice complex fruity aromas, taste is slightly sweet with some fruity flavors, banana, apricot and honey with some spice. not a hint of alcohol in this 9% beer. just as good as the imported belgian tripels, in my opinion, and at about $5.75 for a 750ml bottle its about half the price of some of the more expencive imports.
allagash is great - THeir beers have never dissappointed me and this holds true.  Better than the dubbel and at 9% it¬ís real good ..               .
pours a nice golden with a little fluffy white head. aroma is apricot dust yeast spice. taste is spice yeast malt apricot that slight earthy taste. smooth sweet mouthfeel.

Thick but light, alcoholic but refreshing, sweet but not cloying, this is a wonderfully balanced lighter Belgian beer, just right for the style. No dark roasty flavors, instead a crispness, typical Belgian yeasty smells, a refreshing alocoholic tang, some candy sweetness (especially in the aroma) but a mildly bitter, hoppy finish. It is possible to drink this beer waaaaaaaaaay to fast, trust me. I can taste the honey notes a bit, but I also get a cider tartness that hints at apples. Just great. I like the roasty flavors for the darker Belgians more, but this beer is less a meal than those beers, more an appetizer or a great, strong, expensive nightcap. $8 at liquor store on Addison and Leavitt for a 750 ml bottle.

Fruity..almost lemony aroma with a lot of floral notes. Color of apple juice and with about as much head. Has a very authentic Belgian feel. Candy sugar is there as well as the alcohol and that spiced bread pudding flavor I associate with Belgians. Very soft on the palate and fruity in the finish and aftertaste.
i bought this stuff for 5 bucks, wow was it a good buy.  not the best tripel out there, a little too fruity and not enough malt.  but a bargain

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2005 Aroma is flowers and a little fruit, small white head with fair lacing-mostly diminishing.  Pours a yellow/amber color.  Lightly sweet and lightly bitter, slightly pale, that flower aroma is present in the taste too, complex flavors.  Light to medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation, with a dry slightly bitter finish.  Good flavor, some hops, Strong but doesn¬ít taste alcoholy.
750ml bottle.  Not a bad American made tripel.  Pours gold with a thick white head.  Fruity taste and smell with a little spice of some kind in there.  Not shy about letting you taste the alcohol.
an excellent beer. however, I find american beers are overrated on this site vs. the originals. not sure why still damn good

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2005 Batch #56:  This pours a hazy straw-colored body that¬ís briefly capped by a dense, fizzy head.  Oddly, the scents of pale, sweet malt, sweet-sour cherries, yeast, spices, and alcohol combine into a somewhat medicinal aroma.... not unpleasant, but odd.  The flavor is an interesting blend - sweet malt, alcohol, light, juicy fruits, clove, pepper, other unknown spices, and yeast.  It finishes on a mildly tart, alcohol warm finish.  Very nice.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot, Orland Park, IL<font size=-1>

Had it a bunch of times, never bothered to rate it so I of course had to buy another bottle to refresh my memory. Pours out a beautiful golden color with a nice soft head. The aroma is of sweet fruits and spices. The taste is very up front and strong, with a nice complex flavor of sweet fruit and maybe a little cinamon or clove with some alcohol on the finish. Excellent brew!

Lots of sweetness and yeast in the nose, notes of spices and exotic fruits. SLight hazy yellow body, with a big white head. The flavor is √•retyy much dominated by yeast and alcohol, this becomes too much and very cloying.
Bottled: Yellow coloured. Dusty. Off white head. Spiced, sweet and perfumed aroma. Flavour is sweet and wheaty. Alcohol. Very alcoholdense that last through to the end. A bit to much for my likings.

750 ml bottle - Pours golden fairly clear with a nice white head that laces pretty well down the glass. Aroma of apples, bannana, some yeast, and pepper.  Flavor begins a little sweet with notes of honey.. Then in comes a bit of apple, some clove, and a touch of pepper spice.  A nice honey undertone holds the whole thing together.  The palate is carbonated just right and silky smooth.  Alcohol is undetected throughout the entire bottle.  A very nice tripel. I enjoyed this one!

750ml. bottle batch #63. Hazy golden color with a large, foamy white head. 
Sweet, spicy aroma of coriander, banana, yeast, honey and pepper. Sweet flavor, but in no way cloying, especially with such aggressive carbonation. Yeast, pepper, honey, coriander, banana. The flavor is every bit as complex as the aroma. Warming finish, yet the alcohol is barely noticeable. Excellent!

Batch #56

I like smell of this beer it, smells like triple should.  pours a golden color with a medium head, which stayed with the beer.  complex flavor which i like in a triple.  slight taste of alcohol, but goes down nicely.

Batch #52
Thick-hazed amber with a huge & rocky, bubblicious head and lively, lasting carbonation.  Musty-basement, sour banana, tomato sauce with lemon and white bread dough aromas. Flavor starts with a candy sweetness and ends with an almost-grassy, bitter-sourness. Explosively-creamy mouthfeel with big alcohol in the finish causing some astringency on the palate. For the most part, though, the alcohol is well-masked in aroma and initial flavor.
Pared down review: Bubblicious musty tomato candy explosively-creamy.

I¬ím not sure if that helps.
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot, Orland Park, IL<font size=-1>

Pours a hazy yellow gold with a large white head, but that is more due to me pouring it a bit fast.  The aroma has subtle hints of fruit and some spices in it.  There is a sweetness under it, like bubble gum as well.  Though it is complex, it is hard to smell.  The taste is not as faint but just as complex.  You can taste the fruit¬ís alcohol and the hops are wonderful.  The downer on this for me was the slight bitterness that came upon swallowing.  Other then that it felt good and warmed me up quite a bit as well.

Slightly cloudy blond. Fine white head. Aroma of yeast, flower, and alcohol. Taste is complex: wheat, flowery, some fruit, a little spice, and the alcohol is very apparent. Dry finish. Great lacing the whole time. A thin white head lasted the entire drink. Very good. Though the alcohol aftertaste was a little stronger than I expected (or desired!).
bottled, smooth mild aroma of malt and fruit.  bit spicy and yeasty, a good clone of the style.  worthy of being a triple.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2005 Decent smell, decent taste decent beer. Looking forward to other beers from Allagash
Had another one recently... Still very good. It tastes great despite the high alcohol content.

Bomber, batch 63:  Pours a medium golden color with a large white rocky head which grows from a well carbonated body which won¬ít sit still.  Aomras were peppery spices, some sweet malts, and yeast.  Flavor was awefully watered down weakening the light spiciness even more.  Finishes light and basically clean.

Pours a nice golden color with a nice head.  The aroma was malty and alcoholic.  A nice flavorful blend of spice and fruit with a maltiness to balance the alcohol.  Has a medium body and a pleasant aftertaste.

Nice bottle poured hazy gold with a very strong yeast nose. The head was foamy and clung on to the side for dear life. The nose also has fruit and spice, Pepper? The taste yeast and banana and yes, pepper. The after taste was very good, maybe better then the real thing? The only trace of alcohol is with the warming. NICE for 9%.

[bottle, batch #66] This is first tripel I¬íve experienced, and it pours with a solid head and a cloudy yellowish color. Aroma is outstanding, and flavors are huge - banana, grapefruit and some lemony pepper flavors that are hard to pin down. The aftertaste is very enjoyable, making this beer throughly impressive.

Bottle. Nice one. Even though its a tripel, it reminded me a lot of Duvel or something similiar. Flowery, yeasty, citric. Soft mouthfeel, with some light banana esters. Alcohol is warming, but well hidden. Nice beer.

Not my favorite style, but this was my favorite Tripel so far.  Pours a hazy golden with a strong aroma of hay, bananas, and honey.  Some spice comes out in the flavor, but not so that it takes away from everything else.  Feels light on the tongue but creamy, with a pleasing aftertaste.  Warming without a harsh alcoholic bite.
Bottle poured a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aromas of musty hay,banana, apple, and coriander. Flavors of bread, grapefruit rind, pepper, and ginger.

Batch No. 60: Pours with some lively carbonation and a pillowy, lily-white head; hazy yellow-orange body; it has a super aroma that¬ís woody, somewhat spicy and full of honey, banana, flowers; fairly light bodied yet creamy; notes of sweet banana, lemon and orange peel, pretty heavy floweriness; finishes snappy, dry and tart; nice balance. This is really outstanding.
pours a hazy golden color with a medium-large white head that quickly vanishes. aromas of belgian spices, citrusy fruit, , as well as the taste, good smooth alcohol is present, very drinkable.

Was not incredibly impressed by this beer, but did enjoy it.  750ml bottle at Monk¬ís in Philly.  Poured nicely with a huge aroma of yeast and herbs.  Beautiful aftertaste to this beer, just the flavor left me a bit short.  Definitely prefer the monkey which I just had, but this is nice too.

Batch 39, 750mL bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a thin white head. Some bubbles indicate decent carbonation. Smells a bit of citrus, light fruits. Palate, indeed, from commercial description - bananas, and other things sweet - but tough to nail down completely. Nice post-sip alcohol warmth in the belly. Not quite as ¬íheavy¬í tasting as the tripel I tried last week (Golden Monkey). A nice drink.
user_location: Waco (Buckle of the Bible Belt), Texas, USA

text: UPDATED: OCT 3, 2005 Nice looking golden beer with a big head. Aroma is very sweet with notes of honey and strange fruit. Lovely flavor is very sweet with a dominant honey flavor with hints of apple and sweet fruit. Slightly sour finish balances this beer nicely.

750 ml bottle, batch no 60.
Pours out cloudy golden with a thick creamy beaten egg white head. As it slowly dissapates thick patces of lace are left behind.
aroma is fruity, banana, lemon with some vanilla and honey deep down.
Flavor is lightly sweet, with a honey lemon middle, and a light bitter finish. 
Alcohol is masked very well.

This bottle came courtesy of a trade with Boutip.  Cloudy yellow appearance with a small white head.  Sour citrus aroma.  Strong citrus and yeast taste on a beer that seemed almost wheat like.  Very flavourful citrus actually.  Very light mouthfeel and bubbly carbonation.  Sourness does creep in a little too much for this particular beer.  Quite nice but not amazing - sourness just detracts a little too much.

This is unquestionably one of Allagash¬ís best offerings. Not as brown sugar sweet as a lot of their specialty brews, lighter and less cloying. Aroma of sweet hops and honey. Taste is very dry and bubbly and hints at champagne. Absolutely worth buying and trying even if it¬ís your only Allagash.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, tupalev & jerc -- courtesy of tupalev. As Greg said, this was the last beer of a long session and my notes were somewhat indecipherable but I¬íll do my best. Pours a cloudy yellow with a small fizzy white head. Impressive aroma of yeast, flowery hops, citrus and spices. Pleasant lingering finish, spicy and fruity Belgian flavour. I loved it.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, blankboy, tupalev & jerc - courtesy of tupalev. This was the last beer in a night of big beers from big bottles, so my notes were pretty sparse by this point. All I have scrawled is "hazy golden colour - yeast, spice, fruit, tobacco - sharp, lingering finish - good!". I¬íll try and get my hands on another bottle for a proper rating at some point, but this will have to do for now.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2005 Bottle (750ml) shared with blankboy, jerc, tupalev & gregclow - courtesy of tupalev.  Near end of evening.  Poured with light particle clouding, sparkling yellow with a small fizzy white head, not much lacing.  Light hops and malt, sweet lemon, ash, some yeast.  Flavour very mild but pleasing, carbonated sour lemon, tobacco, fairly nutty - finishes acidic, with wheat, ash, limestone and lemon ending on an astringent note.

Draft at publick house in brookline. Pours a hazy/cloudy yellow color with a thick white head. Nose is spicy, lemony, very floral. Taste is nice and full, the floralness is there with some lemon and spciy notes. Head retains well and leaves decent lacing.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2006 Hazy Pale yellowish color.  Spicy and strong taste.  Superb Belgian sharp cheese tasting yeast with a long dry fruit finish.  Something in the flavor hits the top of the palate and lingers.  The alchol is masked perfectly. Batch 80.  rerated June 1, 06 Available at Downtown Wine & Spirits in Somerville, MA
Batch 58: pours gold with a white head.  Smells of sugar and straw.  Tastes of sugar, rose hips and grass with a creamy finish.  Some honey elements creep in at the end.

This one (thank you for ensuring I sampled it TidiaGuy) had a strong flowery aroma coupled with a rather hoppy taste with banana tones underneath. At least that is what my drunken notes say! This is definately a step above the more marketed Allagash beers but it still has that same spicy finish I associate with their beers.

Bottle Batch #65: Pale yellow, hazy bordering on cloudy, gigantic pillowy white head, superb lacing, lively carbonation. ¬† Spicy nose, peppery and floral, a touch of corriander perhaps, even some citrus peel. ¬† Smells divine! ¬† Peppery start, spicy, otherwise a bit sharp. ¬† Mellows a bit as it warms. ¬† Body and mouthfeel are quite full. ¬† Long lingering finish, spicy and peppery, on a floral bed. ¬† This stuff just kicks so much ass. ¬† One of the best, if not THE best, American made Tripel I have had. ¬† Highly recommended!

Bottle. Hazy yellow in color with a nice head. Malty and hoppy. Citrusy. Hoppy. Tart. Banana and clove notes. Complex. Sweet tasting. Malty and hoppy flavor. Smooth. Well balanced beer. Very drinkable. Nice beer.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 Time to rerate this given that my first rating was from June of 2005 when I was first getting into craft beer. Hazy pale yellow color, moderate head, good lace/retention. Aroma is pepper, alcohol, light honey, sugar, pale malt, fairly fruity. Medium bodied, peppery, dry, still really good for an American Tripel.

corked 750-batch #54.  pours a hazy light orange hue with a big soapy white head.  Lemon, banana, orange peal and big citric aroma with touches if belgian malt, and some brett showing up (this beer has awesome aging potential).  Big banana flavors start, fading into lemon peals, banana, corriander, brett, vanilla and lots of spice.  pretty complex and very tasty.  Palate is the best i have ever had in a trippel-not to abrasive like most of the ilk.  alcohol is pretty well hidden-only shows up a little on the finish.  Some nice tartness shows up in the finish as the beer warms.  I think the next time im in el paso, im picking up some more!!!

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2005 Cork broke in the bottle which sucked ass. Beautiful puffy white head. Creamy, slightly dry palate. Some fruity apple flavors. Quite enjoyable. Don¬ít know if it¬ís worthy of a 98 rating but nevertheless; a solid and very drinkable Tripel. I¬íll give it another shot somewhere down the line.
Thanks to Heemer77 for bringing this over. #53. Yellow color with an off white head. Spicy, sourish aroma with some vanilla? Full body. Slightly spicy, vanilla?, lemon, black pepper. Tasty beer.
